Name: Sr. Business Intelligence Business Analyst
Description: Category:  Business Analysis (functional and technical) City:  Baltimore, Maryland, United States Position ID:  J0918-0093 Employment Type:  Full Time Meet our professionalsCGI: An employer of choice Position Description:Become part of a team to help a large government agency with developing and improving their enterprise Business Intelligence (BI) strategy, data quality and reporting. Your future duties and responsibilities:Provide technical guidance, expertise, and support for developing processes that support the client’s BI Strategy and Initiative, and other related tasks that pertain to using data as a strategic asset.  The qualified resource will perform the following activities: Participate in workgroup and project meetings, provide meeting agendas and notes, and give status reports.Provide recommendations on BI issues to be addressed to increase BI support and value across the agency.Interview Subject Matter Experts (SME) from various client components to identify business rules and requirements,Assist in developing project planning and implementation documentation and other lifecycle artifacts, as necessary.Research and provide industry studies, examples, and best practices for our BI strategies.Report development as necessary. Required qualifications to be successful in this role:• Outstanding analytical and critical thinking skills. Ability to work independently, conduct research, and present findings.Excellent oral and written communication skills, with ability to write formal reports.Proficiency with software such as Visio, PowerPoint, Excel.Ability to develop data analysis scripts utilizing SQL against potential DB2, Oracle, and SQL server databases; Senior level expertise in SQLExperience with developing dashboards and reports with BI tools such as Tableau and WebFocus 8.Subject Matter Expertise – The following skills are demonstrative of BI expertise:BI Report Development,BI and Data Analytics,Data Quality,Data and Business Intelligence Governance,BI Best PracticesDESIRED QUALIFICATIONSIndustry Business Intelligence (BI) views and developing BI initiatives #cgifederaljob What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.  All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.  CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About the Job:NewDay USA is looking for a top notch business mind and modeler to support our operations and business development initiatives. Working closely with Sales, Finance and Human Resources and reporting to the Vice President of Business Development, the Business Analyst will be responsible for financial planning, human capital modeling, business operation planning and process improvements.Responsibilities:Effectively solve and communicate critical operational and financial mattersContribute to the development and execution of NewDay USA’s strategic goals and objectivesPrepare and analyze financial statements and provide key business insightsEstablish and monitor human capital performance, goal development and incentive structureIdentify opportunities for NewDay USA to leverage cross-functional strengths and improve and streamline operational functions in the companyCreate business models and reporting capabilities for various branches of NewDay USAProvide analysis and execution of capital marketsAbout You:You have 3-5 years of finance and operational experience with a proven track record of creative problem solvingYou have a Business, Accounting or Finance degree and a M.B.A. or are currently enrolled in a M.B.A program from a top tier accredited UniversityYou have advanced skills in SQL and ExcelYou are experienced with change management in a high growth environmentYou are an analytical and decisive decision maker with the ability to prioritize and communicate tactics necessary to achieve organizational goalsAbout NewDay USA:NewDay USA is looking for extraordinary team members to help change the lives of America’s veterans and to be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Maryland. Our team is comprised of some of the most diverse, talented and energetic people anywhere in the financial services industry. They are also driven to excel by the exceptional opportunities for growth and advancement that are unique to NewDay USA. Join one of the fastest growing companies voted a “Top Workplace for Career Training” by The Baltimore Sun, and a “Top Entry Level Employer” by CollegeGrad.com.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst- Junior
Description: Refer  Save  Apply  Job ID: CHL-53237 Description: Position Objective:Join our analytics team and help us enable our healthcare providers to improve the lives of our patients. You’ll learn to think globally about the health of our patient populations and drive new insights into interventions that make patients healthier and make the healthcare system more financially sustainable. Use your interest in data analysis to really enhance people’s lives in a direct and measurable way.Essential Job Duties:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions Learns to become proficient in developing reports and analytical tools using Epic Reporting Workbench, Radar, Qlikview, Business Objects, and the Microsoft BI Stack.Collaborates with teammates to enable new insights using SQL and various healthcare analytics tools. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Resource 1 is seeking a Business Analyst for a contract position in Elkridge, MD. The initial term of the contract is 6 months, with expected extensions through all of 2019. The initial project is a modernization and re-write of existing clinical software, leveraging the latest web technologies (Angular/ .Net Core). Candidate should have at least 5 years of experience working as a Business Analyst in support of software development projects. Individual will be responsible for working with users at various levels to gather and write business/ functional requirements to be provided to the development team. Individual will create documentation including user stories, requirements, wireframes, use cases, workflows, etc. Axure will be used for wireframing on the project, so any prior experience would be a plus. Individual will join a team responsible for the full life-cycle development of web-based medical/ clinical software. Would prefer a candidate who has experience working in an Agile environment and is familiar with writing Agile artifacts and participating in Agile ceremonies. Prior healthcare industry experience would be a plus, but is not a requirement. Candidate must possess excellent communication/ documentation skills, energy and enthusiasm for technology. Qualified applicants can e-mail resumes to r1resumes@r1consulting.com for consideration. - provided by DiceBusiness Analysis, Technical Liaison, Agile, User Stories, Business Requirements, Functional Requirements, User Stories, Web Applications, SDLC, MS Office, MS Excel, MS Word, and Axure.

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success. If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price.PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Responsible for analyzing and defining business issues, opportunities, enhancements and implementing solutions. Independently leads moderate to complex projects and/or enhancements to existing processes, including oversight and execution of development, testing, implementation and, post-implementation support, and adoption within the organization. Projects may span weeks and/or months or years and involve coordination with both internal and external parties of various levels. Results have significant impacts on at least one or more groups within the organization  2. Provide analytical support to stakeholders concerning assets and flows data. Gathers and analyzes business requirements for moderate to complex projects as assigned. Incumbent performs necessary investigation, analysis and evaluation to determine feasibility. Incumbent develops and produces project documentation, proposals and business requirements and makes recommendation to stakeholders based on findings  3. Provide research and analytic capabilities regarding financial data for Senior Management. Assets and flows are complex in nature due to the various needs of organization. Focuses on the long-term support of business and it customers.  4. Responsible for using sound business judgment, technical knowledge and project management experience to navigate business lines, exercising influence and persuasion where appropriate. Incumbent works with various levels of the business lines and management and/or external vendors, in addition to internal technology groups, to successfully complete projects on time and within budget. QUALIFICATIONSPreferredBachelor’s Degree in Math, Finance or Accounting5 or more years of demonstrated technical or industry knowledgeProduct knowledgeIntermediate MicroStrategy experienceAdvanced Excel experienceIntermediate Access or SQL experienceIntermediate data visualization experience (Qlik or Tableau)Prior experience leading business/technology projectsUnderstanding of business software/systems analysis techniquesRequiredCollege degree and 2 years related work experience, orAssociate degree and four years of related work experience, orHigh School diploma/equivalent and six years of related work experienceStrong problem-solving, prioritization, and organization skillsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills; position requires interaction with all levels of internal staff and external customers.Self-motivated and self-reliant. Must work well independently and take initiative with assigned projects.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple prioritiesHigh level of analytical and problem-solving skills.Advanced communication skills, both verbal and written.Strong customer relationship skillsNegotiation skills.Process orientation. T. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: IT Technical Analyst II
Description: Venable LLP has an opening for an Information Technology professional to join our team in Baltimore, Maryland.  The Technical Analyst II will be responsible for participating in the building, implementation, assessment and management of the operational infrastructure procedures and processes needed to execute the IT services delivery lifecycle.  The ideal candidate will be responsible for... Collaborating with the technical design and architecture teams to transition and maintain multiple intermediate systems and servicesWorking with team manager to assess and evaluate service transition requirements prior to Service Management Office (SMO) acceptance of services or systemsParticipating in defining and maintaining roles and responsibilities for operational support during and after transition of new services and systemsCoordinating incident management process changes necessary to support transitioned systems and servicesContributing guidance on KPI’s and dashboards relative to system performance and service operationProviding input into the design and configuration related to managing and tracking configuration items effectively  The successful candidate will demonstrate...A minimum of 3 years of experience in the following areas: o Windows Server 2008+, with a strong understanding of Active Directory, File Shares/Permissions, DFS, DHCP/DNS, Application Fault Isolation  o VMware vCenter, including installation and management (or VCP4+)  o Network and patch management systems  o Administering Event management systems  o Multi-tiered database applications Strong knowledge of Web Server technologies such as IIS and/or ApacheStrong knowledge of database technologies and management tools; ability to create, test and run SQL scripts and jobsKnowledge of enterprise block and file storage systems such as EMC, Nimble and/or HitachiKnowledge of network devices and firewallsKnowledge of asynchronous replicationAbility to create PowerShell scripts to automate tasksExperience with IT Service Management processesA commitment to working as part of a team and offering feedback to facilitate positive outcomes.The ability to participate in the on-call rotation for after-hours and weekend support for major incidents or escalated problems. If you have a can-do attitude and are looking to be part of a highly motivated team of individuals who are naturally ambitious and driven, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!  Venable LLP is an American Lawyer Global 100 law firm headquartered in Washington, DC, with offices in California, Delaware, Maryland, New York, and Virginia. Our lawyers and legislative advisors serve domestic and international clients in all areas of corporate and business law, complex litigation, intellectual property, regulatory matters, and government affairs. Additional information can be found at www.Venable.com.  Venable LLP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, committed to ensuring our workforce reflects America’s diverse population.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Summary  CRISP is seeking a business analyst to join the Point Solutions team. The incumbent will join a team responsible for developing and delivering mission critical new software applications for the CRISP Health Information Exchange. The ideal applicant will be an excellent verbal and written communicator, will have an attention to detail, the ability to solve coordinate with a number of stakeholders, manage priorities, and the ability to identify and resolve problems. The business analyst plays a critical role on the software development team to ensure delivered products meet requirements.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Contribute to the design and development of software products that assist in facilitating the exchange of health information for healthcare professionalsTake ownership of business processes and product development and overall success of the serviceWork with different stakeholders and subject matter experts from different backgrounds (clinical, business, technical).Assist in coordination of the Agile/Scrum development process.Assist QA in the reviewing test cases and ensuring appropriate test coverage.Participate in full software lifecycle solution and learn new technologies.Help your team solve difficult problems - learning from and sharing with team members.Assist in the transition of developed services to operations teamsManage priorities and requests in an organized mannerUnderstand how services are being used and use that knowledge to inform future developments Qualifications  To perform this job successfully, the incumbent must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Ability to quickly understand and take ownership of business processes and product development plansAbility to work with many different stakeholders and subject matter experts from different backgrounds (clinical, business, technical)Experience with Agile/Scrum methodology, particularly with the Product Owner role and with writing User Stories and Acceptance CriteriaExperience with writing and executing test casesTake pride in delivering software that meets the client’s needsKnowledge of Agile incremental development methodsDemonstrated ability to work well on a diverse teamJira and Github experience preferredFamiliarity with Microsoft Azure preferred Company DescriptionAnchor Technical Services specializes in servicing organizations that are in need of highly skilled technical resources in the fields of Engineering, Environmental, Healthcare, Information Technology, and Science. Additionally, ATS works with qualified candidates to arrange career placement within leading organizations in a variety of technical sectors. What’s more, Anchor Technical Services delivers unparalleled customer service with an emphasis on follow through and attention to detail to ensure ideal placements and your long-term success.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: MAXIMUS is a leading operator of government health and human services programs and has partnered with state, federal and local governments to provide critical, high quality health and human service programs to a diverse array of communities. Operating under MAXIMUS's founding mission of Helping Government Serve the People® since 1975, MAXIMUS Federal Services is entirely focused on helping government agencies run programs cost-effectively and serve program constituents with improved outcomes. By being a responsible steward for government programs, we help the federal government deliver on its promises through our people, process and technology. Our focus is always on outcomes and results that connect citizens more effectively with government services. Job Summary: The Business Analyst provides recommendations based on business analysis and subject matter expertise to the operations management team for improving operational performance. The Business Analyst provides guidance and recommendations for performing processes and procedures and provides direction for achieving production goals. Essential Job Duties: *Coordinates with business users to define business processing activities, data availability, and requirements, to implement operational procedures *Collects, analyzes and interprets both qualitative and quantitative data; performs analytical and root cause analyses *Utilizes management and planning tools (flow diagrams, affinity diagrams, gap analysis, and selection/prioritizing matrices) *Facilitates discussions between operations teams, technical teams and business stakeholders on business processes and procedures *Creates user acceptance test scripts/test plans *Assists in efforts to provide training, communication, presentations, and project documentation/artifacts *Assists in training and standards development among peer business analysts *Supports the project manager and/or product owner and stakeholders on project priorities *Assists in maintaining project deadlines, budgets, and schedules *Develops and produces reports as needed *Performs other duties as assigned Education and Experience Requirements: *Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university required; equivalent work experience will be considered in lieu of degree *At least three (3) years of experience in related field required *High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Outlook *Experience with Microsoft Project, Vision and SQL *Proficient with software quality assurance and release management processes *Ability to analyze current situations with new requirements to synthesize into creative solutions Additional Requirements, as per contract/client: *United States Citizenship Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience. May have additional training or education in area of specialization. Develops solutions to a variety of problems of moderate scope & complexity. General application of concepts & principles. Contributes to the completion of organizational projects & goals. Frequent use and general knowledge of industry practices, techniques, and standards. Applies knowledge and skills to complete a wide range of tasks. Communicates on complex or sensitive issues or drafts such responses for supervisor or manager. A committed and diverse workforce is our most important resource. MAXIMUS is and Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. MAXIMUS provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disabled status. - provided by DiceBusiness Analyst

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst job in Crownsville, Maryland. Business Analyst Job Overview:Analyze the business processes, procedures, organizational structure, etc. in order to identify problems and determine solutions that reduce risk and increase organizational effectiveness and efficiencyInteract with the business partners and internal and external stakeholders,including executive staff, to understand organizational processes and needsPerform detailed gap analysis to identify gaps between system functionality and organizational needs and document findingsWork with stakeholders to identify project scope, project objectives, project success criteria and project deliverablesCollaborate with project stakeholders and technical staff to elicit and document requirements (e.g. business, functional, non-functional, process models, etc.)Present solutions to business stakeholders and facilitate the iterative refinement of requirementsWork with the Development and Quality Assurance teams to ensure functional requirements are unambiguous and testableAssist in the creation of test cases to verify the system and validate the system and processes are functioning as expectedCreate and maintain project logs to ensure that issues and risks are documented and tracked to resolution; monitor project schedules and follow up with leadership with concerns related to project milestones and timelinesBusiness Analyst Job Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college in Business or Public Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a related fieldFive (5) years of experience as a business analyst or closely related experience in the analysis of student information systems.Exceptional analytical skills in order to properly interpret business needs and translate into functional requirementsAbility to work in both collaborative and independent environmentsAbility to work under aggressive timelinesAbility to communicate effectivelyThorough knowledge of the principles and practices of planning, developing, implementing, and maintaining student information systemsThorough knowledge of processes, methods, and techniques utilized to analyze and evaluate business operations and document requirementsKnowledge of programming concepts and various Systems DevelopmentLifecycle (SDLC) methodologies.Working Knowledge of Web Accessibility Guidelines 2.0.Fluent language skills and written communication ability.Experience with developing reports, documents, presentations, etc.Experience creating record documents, to include agendas, project logs, meeting notes, etc.Proficiency with MS Office, to include strong competency with Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook.Proficiency in developing and presenting, both verbally and in writing, technical information and presentations to non-technical audiences. FSR is nationwide, award winning, multi-industry workforce solution organization. FSR has grown from providing healthcare professionals to government healthcare facilities to providing talent acquisition, recruiting, and specialized human resources for the private and public sector.  FSR matches talented individuals to organizations to create mutually beneficial, sustainable partnerships.  We invite you to join our team and grow with us!  FSR is a women-owned, minority, small business based out of Maryland. Ask about our Working Warriors Program.  FSRpeople.com

Name: Senior Analyst
Description: Baltimore-based Stansberry Research is a high-growth, independent, subscription-based publisher of financial information, dedicated to helping millions of people around the world become better investors.We are a team-oriented, fast-paced, and results-driven employer. Everyone who works here can make a difference and has the power to influence the success of the company. We value people with great ideas who partner with others to take action and accomplish goals.What is the role we are recruiting for?We're looking for an enthusiastic, inquisitive entry-level SeniorAnalyst to join the research team of our market monitoring/trading service, Stansberry NewsWire. Working closely with the rest of the team, your goal is to research and analyze publicly traded equities, markets, economic, and political events and trends.Responsibilities include:Analyzing financial performance of selected companies.Interpreting data to understand industry dynamics, trends, and business drivers.Presenting research in written form, complete with rigorous citations, to the Senior Analysts.Communicating analysis and debating conclusions with the investment team.Monitoring news flow to single out the important topics of the day.*Your valued contributions will be published in our daily updates.What qualities do I need to have?Undergraduate degree (Bachelor of Science preferred)Minimum of 7 years professional experience working in a collaborative environmentAdvanced analytical skills and financial knowledgeProficiency in Microsoft ExcelExtraordinary writing skillsAbility to simplify complex ideasKeen interest in economics, the financial markets, and investmentsAbility to work on a diverse team under deadline pressureComfortable taking initiative and being resourceful/entrepreneurialStrong interpersonal and relationship-building skillsAbility to monitor, stay on top of, and relay the important trends and events in a specific sector of the marketWhat qualities are good for me to have, but not required?Experience analyzing, creating, and marketing investment ideasUnderstanding of macroeconomics and/or microeconomicsAbility to write creativelyExperience with a Bloomberg terminal As an employer recognized for our exceptional commitment to employees, we are able to offer a wide variety of benefits, programs, and services which address the needs of employees and their families. Our benefits include but are not limited to: medical and dental, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), paid holidays, and vacations.At Stansberry Research, we thrive on new ideas and the entrepreneurial spirit. Naturally, we always look for new people, explorers, and innovators. If you are interested in a career where your ideas won't only be heard but rather celebrated, we'd like to hear from you. Please forward your resume, cover letter and writing sample to: Analystcareers@stansberryresearch.com referencing Junior Analyst in the subject line.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.About the Company:Founded in 1999 and based in Baltimore, Maryland, Stansberry Research is the largest independent source of financial insight in the world. It delivers unbiased investment advice to self-directed investors seeking an edge in a wide variety of sectors and market conditions.Stansberry Research has nearly two dozen analysts and researchers – including former hedge-fund managers and buy-side financial experts. They produce a steady stream of timely research on value investing, income generation, natural resources, biotech, financials, short-selling, macroeconomic analysis, options trading and more.The company's uncompromised insight has made it one of the most respected and sought-after research organizations in the financial sector. Stansberry Research has nearly one million readers and more than 350,000 paid subscribers in over 100 countries.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe are looking for staff with demonstrated experience in program management or operational experience in Medicaid or Health and Human Services programs. This experience should be in the healthcare, human services, public sector, or information technology fields.  We are looking for 5 to 10 years of business analysis and a bachelor's degree in a related field is preferred.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Abacus Solutions Group needs a Business Analyst for a new multi-office IT project request (and eventual IT project) regarding document management throughout the design, planning, procurement, and execution of construction and maintenance projects. This resource will elicit requirements from representatives of all affected offices; gather relevant documentation; investigate, analyze and document the relevant business process; then work with other OIT staff to investigate potential solutions and facilitate the project approval process. This resource will then serve as the business analyst and tester on the IT project team which includes requirements gathering, analysis and documentation, developing and maintaining wire frames, developing flow charts, developing and executing test plans, and taking meeting minutes. It is possible that there will be spin-off IT requests or IT projects from the initial analysis effort that this person will need to participate on. Additionally, this resource could be asked to participate on other IT requests / IT projects that require the same skills and experience if his/her workload permits. - provided by DiceBusiness Analysis, Testing

Job Req ID:  11959 Business AnalystClassified Title: Business Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/04/PD  Starting Salary Range: $57,544-$65,000  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: M-F, 8:30am - 5:00pm  Exempt Status: Exempt  Location: 04-MD:School of Medicine Campus  Department name: 60006026-Tech Transfer  Personnel area: Academic and Business Centers General summary/purpose: This position reports to the Manager of the Commercialization Strategy Group (CSG) within Johns Hopkins Technology Ventures (JHTV). In this role, the Business Analyst supports the technology commercialization activities of JHTV by performing assessments of new technologies and venture opportunities to assist with planning the management of new venture opportunities. Specific duties & responsibilities:Reviews and understands technologies disclosed to Johns Hopkins University.Searches relevant prior art to determine the ability to patent this new technology.Analyzes commercial factors such as market size, developmental risk and competitive environment to turn new technologies into commercial products.Conducts in-depth research to understand the structure of specific industries and identify potential partners that can assist in commercialization efforts.Develops a working knowledge of the technology commercialization process, formation of new companies, and the process for obtaining funding for the new companies.Supervisory responsibility: ~2 to 4 student interns Minimum qualifications (mandatory): Bachelor’s degree in a biological or engineering related science required. Minimum 2 years’ experience in marketing, preferably life and physical sciences technologies or working in industry in a similar function. Preferred qualifications: Advanced degree preferred, but not required, in a related science or a MBA with experience in biotechnology fields. Special knowledge, skills, and abilities:Able to understand complex technologies and develop concise, clear synopses of the technologies.Resourceful with data gathering, manipulation of large data sets, and quantitative analysis.Able to think creatively about potential commercial applications for new technologies and how JHTV might facilitate commercialization.Able to deal well with unstructured problems.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.Detail oriented and highly organized. The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly. During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. Name: IT System Analyst
Description: The System Analyst will work closely with end users to help trouble shoot any issues that they encounter, as well as assist in the development/documentation of best practices for the clinical applications. The System Analyst will also work closely with 3rd party software vendors to address issues that Remedi associates are experiencing in various applications. Works closely with application product owners to assess and discuss requests for new processes and or new capabilities within 3rd party softwareWork closely with 3rd party vendors and IT Operations to troubleshoot issues and discuss upcoming software releasesAssess new software releases for impact on business operations and technical environmentAssists with defining and documenting functional and non-functional requirements to create consistency across enterprise systems.Designs and implements new methods, procedures, and systems (both automated and manual) to improve the processing and flow of information within the company.Provides detailed documentation of moderately complex system specifications for maintenance and upgrades, including system scripts, system installation procedures, system backup and recovery techniques and system test methods.Creates ad-hoc reports for pharmacy personnel related to various clinical applications in order to provide prompt decision making capabilities to managementCaptures technical test cases for integration with 3rd party interfaces.Captures sequence diagram and topology diagrams to illustrate system flow.Prepares system documentation for operational use and supports operational tests.Arrive at possible solution alternatives factoring in gap resolution, functional areas, acceptability of solution to user community, technical feasibility and efficiencyAnalyze problems and provides troubleshooting during deployment, identify viable solutions, and determine best course of actionCustomer orientation - Builds relationship with stakeholders and vendor partners.Must be able to work under minimal supervision and be a self-starterMust be able to multitaskExperience working with appropriate operating systems, hardware and softwareFundamental knowledge of Microsoft applications including MS Office, Visio and MS Project.Experience working with relational databases to facilitate systems analysisMust have experience in design, development, testing and evaluation of computer based systems.Must possess specific experience in the analysis and design of business applications on complex, large-scale mission critical systems, including experience in database management concepts.Ability to quickly assimilate and understand the core functionality of information systems used within the companyAbility to execute troubleshooting and root cause analysis related to problems associated with the systemof responsibilityAnalytical and problem solving skills for design, creation and testing of programsKnowledge of healthcare, EMRs, and HL7 a plus.Knowledge of Microsoft Powershell scripting a plusInterpersonal skills to interact with customers and team membersBachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field preferred or equivalent combination of education and experienceTwo or more years of system analysis or systems development experience

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionGreat Business Analyst opportunity in downtown Baltimore.  The Business Analyst will have responsibility for the implementation of the new CRM Salesforce platform. They will work closely with a 3rd party integrator and all stakeholders within the organization. Data analysts will independently develop analysis and design reporting capabilities. They will also monitor company performance and identify improvements for capturing information and integration between all reporting systems. The data analyst must be work well in group settings and have the skill set to turn data concepts into measurable results. Responsibilities Interpret and analyze key performance indicators to provide meaningful standardized reports  Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize efficiency and consistency  Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems  Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets  Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance metrics to locate and correct code problems  Work with management to prioritize business and information needs  Locate and define new process improvement opportunities  Work with multiple teams within the company to provide critical information to be used in strategic decision making  Be willing to be a crucial member of world renowned organization Requirements 5+ years working experience as a data/business analyst or similar field  Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques  Have a general understanding of business including marketing, sales, operations, and finance  Highly skilled in Microsoft Office, especially Excel, including pivot tables, creating datasets, and analyzing large data pools  Extensive knowledge of CRMs (e.g. Salesforce.com) is required  Industry knowledge of medical/healthcare services industry is preferred or relatable industry  Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy  Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings  Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or other relevant field  MBA or Masters degree is not required but may be beneficial

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Our client provides a wide range of strategy development, business and advisory services, program management, and training services to government and commercial clients.  They are seeking a Business Analyst (100% virtual position). JOB DESCRIPTION • Perform peer reviews, review any updates done to the requirement or to the ruleset configuration. Maintain Test data set to perform any internal testing.Load ruleset to the Business Analyst Environment to Unit test any new Configuration or updates to the existing configuration.Review/Create New Requirements or Change Requests.Update existing Requirements.Review/Create New Business Rules.Update existing Business Rules and implement any changes to the Rulesets.Review/Analyze and log defects in JIRA pertaining the files received/processed from MMPs.Review/Analyze and create any new Test cases.Update any existing Test case.Sort and group together test cases from UAT Test case list to different cycles in JIRA.Execute and analyze the test cases sorted in different cycles in JIRA. REQUIRED SKILLS • Experience with CMS Encounter Data3-5 years claims system business analyst experienceExpertise in validating CMS claims against data provided by medical plans;Experience with processing NCCI , MUE, WEDI Snip editing;Extensive knowledge of Medicare/Medicaid state-specific claim processing rulesets;Experience with Analysis and validation of EDI 837, 277 CA transactional processing;Working experience with interfaces of claims pricing and editing tools;Working experience with rule-based engines, such as DROOLS; MS Office suite;SDLC Proficiency;Experience working with Agile Lifecycle and methodologies;Excellent communication skills;Excellent writing skills.Technical experience with unit testing and validation;SQL knowledge; Database (Oracle);General Healthcare domain knowledge;Knowledge of Medicare benefits;Experience with JIRA and Confluence. REQUIRED EDUCATION • Bachelors’ degree EOE M/F/Disability/VetOur Client will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OverviewDo you have a passion for designing software from the ground up? Are you comfortable working with a range of projects submitted from a global user base? Do you get a thrill from working with customers to gather requirements and translating them into functioning software? If your honest answer to each question is an enthusiastic YES, then we wants to hear from you.  14 West, an Agora company, is looking for a Software Business Analyst to work within a fast-paced, mature agile team. As a Software Business Analyst you will assist with all phases of the software development life cycle including gathering and translating business requirements into functional development specifications, following development tasks to completion, and investigating ways to optimize current functionality and processes.  Being a part of this team means living and breathing product goals and fierce collaboration with teammates, colleagues, and customers. The first step to success in this role is working hard for your teammates and earning their trust. They expect all members of the team to display initiative, take responsibility for managing their own work, and be open to guidance and insight from those around them.ResponsibilitiesServe as a liaison between the customer community and the software development team to gather and communicate requirements which help define and verify product design.Coordinate, schedule, and lead customer-focused collaboration sessions.Elicit, analyze, validate, and manage the true needs of their customers.Translate business and user requirements into functional requirements via customer collaboration.Create design mocks using wireframe and prototyping software.Conduct follow-up conversations with customers, as needed.Serve as a resource for engineering and quality assurance; clarifying requirements throughout the software development life cycle.Maintain and update requirements as needed throughout the software development life cycle.Create and distribute release notes to customers and internal stakeholders.Work closely with the Product Manager to document product vision and roadmap.Support internal staff by communicating and training new functionality prior to releases.Work with Quality Assurance to record and/or review test plans, test scenarios, and test cases results in preparation for regression testing and product validation.Communicate clearly and effectively, face-to-face and in writing.Be a team player and be glad to pitch in to help teammates in need.Work until the job is done and done well. QualificationsExperience and EducationBS in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related.2+ years of previous experience in software development business analysis.Previous experience in related software development life cycle activities or support.A fundamental understanding of Agile software development.Skills & AbilitiesInnate curiosity about processes, systems and user functionality.Demonstrated ability to analyze problems and understand the necessary components of a solution through analysis, planning, evaluation of cost/benefit, testing and reporting.Maintain a sense of urgency and hold others accountable to get working software out the door.Be ready to report on projects formally and on-the-fly.Ruthless team collaborator, ready to give and receive constructive feedback.If interested, please submit a resume and cover letter to the link provided.About 14 West 14 West is the business services arm of The Agora Companies, and has offices in Baltimore City, Maryland and Delray Beach, Florida.  The company exists to provide the support of seasoned, passionate and inspired administrative professionals. So while they focus on growing their enterprises through new ideas, we ensure the well-being of their workplace.  14 West prefers to fill its offices with people who aren’t afraid to think outside of the box. People who will come in and already start asking: “How can we do this differently, and not just differently, but better?” ­­  The company tends to look for individuals in search of more than just a paycheck.

Name: All Source Analyst
Description: Req ID 102381BR  Business Title All Source Analyst  Group MCIS  Location USA MARYLAND Fort Meade  Clearance Level Needed TS/SCI  Category Intelligence  Job Duties and Responsibilities Entering ManTech’s 50th year, we hold the distinct honor of being named a “Top 100 Global Technology Company” by Thomson Reuters. We have earned this and many other accolades over the years for our dedication to serving the missions of our nation’s most important customers: U.S. Intelligence, Defense and Federal Civilian agencies. All know us as a trusted partner offering best-in-class solutions in cyber, data collection & analytics, enterprise IT, and systems and software engineering tailored to meet their specific requirements.Become an integral part of a diverse team in the Mission, Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (MCIS) Group. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, mission oriented All Source IOSB Analyst in the Ft. Meade, MD area, with strong Customer relationships. At ManTech, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.The IMS Division provides cyber solutions to a wide range of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. This division consists of a team of technical leaders that deliver advanced technical solutions to government organizations. Our customers have high standards, are technically adept, and use our products daily to support their mission of protecting national security. Our contributions to our customer’s success is driving our growth.Job Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to: Provide general military intelligence analysis and organizational expertise dealing with threats to the U.S Army/DoD interests worldwide Conduct all-source research and threat analysis of counterintelligence, counterterrorism, force protection, and information operations of foreign military forces and their operations, capabilities, activities and trends to support all-source intelligence and threat production, particularly in the areas of threats to U.S. Army and DoD equities Provide support to counterintelligence investigation through liaison with Counterintelligence Agents and other members of the DoD and intelligence community Provide record checks, data research and social networking analysis through the use of intelligence and law enforcement databases and search engines Provide in - depth research regarding biographical intelligence in order to aid investigations, support subject interviews, and case development Conduct research using social networking tools, digital mapping programs, and law enforcement database and research tools, to include Open Source (OSINT) and classified searches Analyze intelligence information to assess developments, trends, and threat implications through comprehensive knowledge of intelligence threat analysis to include forecasting and/or other analytical methodologies Analyze terrorist and Foreign Intelligence Entity (FIE) threats to U.S. Army Forces, programs and operations Provide recommendations on techniques and innovative methods employed in threat analysis and protection Research and analyze military, political, economic, technical and other developments within assigned areas to conduct valid threat assessments Identify intelligence gaps and assist in the development of intelligence collection programs Advise team leaders and chain of command on intelligence findings Plan, coordinate, and synthesize research to prepare all-source intelligence products and responses Ensure products fulfill DA, DoD, and national – level intelligence requirementsBrief intelligence assessments and positions to senior civilian and Army personnelPosition Requirements:Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, and seven to nine years of related experience.In addition to analytic skills, have familiarity with CI operational and investigative concepts and procedures, so they are better able to provide relevant analysis to the CI agents and managers they support. (Familiarity with similar HUMINT or law enforcement operational investigative concepts may suffice). Examples of advanced knowledge and skills needed include familiarity with priority threat languages, regional and threat country expertise, and/or skills in technical espionage or terrorist tradecraft.Security Requirements:An active TS/SCI Security Clearance is required.  Qualifications Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, and seven to nine years of related experience.  Degrees Equivalent Experience/EducationBachelor's Degree Years of Experience 11-13 years w/High School Diploma05-07 years w/Bachelors Degree02-04 years w/Masters Degree Position Type Full-Time  Shift Day  Overview For more than 40 years, ManTech employees have been solving complex problems for the national security community. We are comprised of approximately 10,000 talented employees around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Half our employees have a military background, and more than 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,000 active contracts with more than 40 different government agencies.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: About CallRevuFounded in 2010, CallRevu is a call management software company for the automotive industry. CallRevu’s key focus is to help automobile dealers measure and improve the most common contact point with their customers: the phone. With mobile phones increasingly being used as the primary search venue for consumers, the click-to-call functionality is driving growing call volumes into dealerships. To address this growing channel, CallRevu provides valuable insights through the tracking, monitoring and summarizing of inbound and outbound calls to dealerships, and delivers real-time interactive text alerts on poorly handled calls to first responders in less than thirty minutes. Through this lead management approach, CallRevu helps clients increase market share, customer retention and loyalty, and profitability in all phases of dealership operations.CallRevu’s network of strategic partners includes prominent OEMs such as Honda, Subaru, VW, Ford, Toyota, General Motors, Chrysler and Nissan, as well as some of the largest and most influential Automotive Dealer Groups in the world.About the Role:The Financial Analyst will lead the annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting processes, prepare Board of Director, Investor, and internal management financial presentations, develop key reporting packages, analyze and track key performance indicators (KPIs), and will also be instrumental in strategic planning process.This is a highly visible role that will work closely with the CFO and COO and act as the analytical engine of the company to provide insights and support ‘optimal’ business decision making,This role will report directly to the CFO.About You:Highly analytical with the ability to act both strategically and tactically, as well as ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve and prioritize.Exceptionally detail oriented and able to translate big-picture analysis while never losing sight of the finer points.Technical capability and hands-on willingness to build complex financial modelsExperience producing insightful, actionable analysis for senior management, board members, investors and other stakeholders.Deep understanding of subscription software business models and metrics.Extremely curious - not satisfied with easy or convenient answers; drives issues to root cause challenge status quo – identify opportunities for process improvement.Ability to work comfortably with incomplete information and deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced, high-pressure environmentAbility and desire to roll up sleeves and be hands on in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment that may require work outside of normal business hours to meet deadlines.Ability to tackle multiple projects and work in situations with changing priorities, and multiple simultaneous deadlines.Proactive individual seeking additional responsibility at all times.Demonstrated ability, and solid business acumen, capable of establishing and improving processes and procedures.Compelling and inclusive communication skills, strong teamwork and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to build relationships and effectively influence business partners.Key Responsibilities:Financial Planning:Develop and prepare annual budget. Assist in setting annual budget targets, lead the company through the process and prepare the annual financial budget for presentation to executive management and Board of Directors.Manage the overall Company financial model (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) and Lead the monthly, quarterly and annual cycles for financial forecasting and reporting and ensure timely and accurate reporting and communication of actuals vs. forecast.Partner with the business leads to accurately reflect and review revenue/cost forecast and pipeline.Assist the team in monthly and quarterly reporting including executive summary preparation and external reporting documentation for results.Innovate and improve the cross-functional financial planning processes, reporting standards and KPIsImprove operating teams' understanding of financial statements and budget adherence with thoughtful and transparent analysis.Cultivate deep partnership with Accounting to create efficient and seamless actual versus budget and forecast analysis and reporting.Mine historical results for trends to improve the accuracy of forecast model assumptions and drivers.Develop and monitor key performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance, including all areas of revenue, cost of sales, expenses, operating metrics and capital expendituresFinancial Analysis :Provide decision-support to business partners across the company on key financial and operational topics through data analysis and business understanding.Collaborate with operating teams and provide fact-based recommendations that improve profitability, operating efficiency and effectiveness.Create scenario analyses including to evaluate the growth, profitability and cashflow implications of various avenues related to investment opportunities the company might chose to pursue.Develop and optimize performance against key financial indicators relevant to strategic initiatives such as the launch of a new product offering or entry into a new geographic or vertical marketInitiate proactive business dialogue; challenge assumptions to ensure sound financial decisions are being made that improve business performance.Provides financial analysis to business operations and creates reports to be provided to executives.Evaluates performance metrics to determine acceptable levels of quality or efficiency for various business functions.Go deep with ad hoc analysis to generate business insight and action recommendations.Experience and Qualifications:5-7 years of experience in a financial planning and analysis role, expertise in supporting a rapidly growing SaaS technology organization preferred.Strong understanding of budgets, forecasts, financial statements and accounting principles required.Proven advanced Excel and superior financial modeling skills required.Netsuite and Salesforce experience highly desired.Exceptional project management skills with strong attention to detail.Demonstrable problem-solving, quantitative, and analytical skills; strategic and critical thinking.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Salisbury Management Inc. At Salisbury Management, Inc. Our job is to allow the companies we serve do what they do best which is provide quality care to their patients, consumers and students. SMI is a recognized leader in offering professional, operational, and management services. Our goal is to provide a complete array of professional administrative services to companies that need to minimize the complexity of day to day administrative operations, so they can get to the business they do best by caring for the individuals they serve. Salisbury management Inc. is searching for a qualified Business Analyst who will be a vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analysis, design, testing, deployment and support of systems that deliver value to our clinical stakeholders. This individual will play an active hand on role in reviewing and documenting current state business processes and recommending and designing future state business processes and working to improve operational efficiencies. Responsibilities and Duties:Elicit and document requirements using document analysis, requirement workshops, business process descriptions use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts decompose high-level information into details, abstracts up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user request from the underlying true needs.Proactively communicate and collaborate with internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and identify areas that need improvement or updating.Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously as required.Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding on how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements in the healthcare industry.Serve as the IT Departments liaison between the business community, stakeholders and the IT team members through which requirements and specifications will flow.Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language.Collaborate with IT team members and other subject matter experts to establish the solution vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability, cost and efficiencies gainedActively participate in the QA process as needed.RequirementsMinimum Qualification & Skill:Bachelor’s Degree in IT/ computer Science or relevant work experience3 years of experience in Business/ System Analysis and Quality AssuranceHealthcare industry experienceProven experience in eliciting requirements and testingExperience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and toolsExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, staff and other subject matter experts.Experience in cost/benefit and ROI analysis.Be result oriented and have a record of success in meeting deadlines.Benefits Eligible Salisbury Management Employees will receive: Competitive pay, and benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)Employee Discount ProgramRewards program which allows you to earn points to purchase items401k options option Salisbury Management Inc. is an equal opportunity Employer. For more information, visit: www.salisburymgt.com

Name: Business Analyst
Description: I. General Summary Under limited supervision of departmental leadership, gathers and analyzes prospective user needs. Develops and maintains an information system to efficiently meet the department’s needs. Documents fact finding results and makes formal presentations of findings, recommendations and specifications. Demonstrates fiscal responsibility in the preparation and adherence to the capital and operational budgets.  II. Principal Responsibilities and Tasks The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by personnel so classified.  1. Prepares various reports, surveys and special projects as requested by senior management or for miscellaneous requesting agencies in accordance with departmental procedures. Reviews transactions from various reports and prepares summary reports for reporting organizational activity by the appropriate UMMC Ambulatory department in accordance with departmental procedures.  2. Develops and implements procedures to perform tasks required by internal management or outside regulatory agencies.  3. Prepares timely and accurate monthly reports for Ambulatory Services and other outpatient centers. Prepares and issues reports and trending analyses, and performs evaluations of new programs/ventures.  4. Applies accounting and auditing principles and techniques to ensure that data integrity, internal controls, and audit trails are maintained throughout applications.  5. Reviews Ambulatory centers denial data. Provides ambulatory local center leadership with denial information and works with the teams to implement denial mitigation strategies. Collaborates with UMM Managed Care representatives to leverage payer relationships.  6. Organizes and maintains major reports and schedules containing complex data from multiple sources.  7. Trains operations managers and administrative staff on reading reports and interpreting financial data.  8. Supports preparation and maintenance of capital equipment, operational and salary budgets.  9. Performs professional work related to special projects involving report creation, financial analysis, or financial management, as required.  10. Interprets and implements variance reports for leadership team. Identifies areas of billing insufficiencies and proactively conducts audits regarding reconciliations, batching and patient billing. Supports outpatient centers with process improvement initiatives.  11. Communicates with various departments in order to resolve various budget-related financial problems and procedures. Assists manager/analyst in understanding variances from budget and assists in documenting new issues that impact the current and future budget development.  12. Informs and educates staff as to the cost of operating the department. Organizes and stores management information in electronic and paper formats for future retrieval. Develops tools and methods to gather source data for entry. Performs necessary programming as required.  13. Prepares and distributes routine internal reports to ensure accurate revenue capture and compliance, adherence to operational standards and achieving overall center health. Responsible for implementing continuous education process for departments which will teach the importance of charge capture and advise departments of effective procedures for completing the charge capture function.Protects departmental confidentiality with regard to sensitive data access and maintains an objective demeanor in conducting all duties related to business systems analyses.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Robert Half Technology is currently seeking a Business Analyst for a contract position in Baltimore. Review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs. Document requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies. Familiar with relational database concepts and client-server concepts. Rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Job Requirements Responsibilities: Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed Validate resource requirements and develop cost estimate models Conduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making Plan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required and presents findings of studies to client committees Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reports Review a variety of areas including operations, purchasing, inventory, distribution and facilities Understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes Suggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changes Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues - provided by DiceAnalyst, Business Analyst, Database, Development, Management, Metrics, Project, Research

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Work Location: MD, Woodlawn Job Code 605Apply NowAt CollabraLink, we’re committed to providing federal clients with simple and intuitive solutions that increase efficiency and enhance citizen engagement. Using advanced technology, rigorous processes and trusted guidance, we’re making government more interactive, productive and secure. We understand that our employees are our greatest asset. Our goal is to create an environment where employees can do important, purposeful work and be rewarded for individual and team success.CollabraLink is seeking a Business Analyst to join our team. The Business Analyst role requires experience formulating and defining business requirements for technical engineers that would support the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP).Responsibilities:Develop business, functional and non-functional requirements specifications according to standard templates.Elicit requirements based on document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Hands-on business/system process and requirements analysis including documenting as-is and designing to-be business/system processes.Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Serve as a liaison between business owners, technology teams and support teams.Perform onsite data collection to analyze standard operating procedures and process models.Participate in ongoing decisions regarding design, data collection, data analysis, methodology, and process improvement.Validate requirements post implementation.Collaborate with Federal stakeholders and the MACPro project team to ensure timely completion of assigned tasks with minimal direction.Build subject matter expertise in Medicaid and CHIP policies and provide input to working groups.Required Experience:5+years of business analysis experience with a focus on healthcare.Agile methodology experience and business analysis experience.Working knowledge of the SDLC.Prior experience writing business and system level requirements on data centric analytics type projects and applications.Excellent attention to detail and exceptional oral and written communication skills.Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.Excellent time management, scheduling, and organizational skills.Ability to work well independently or in a team setting.Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent educational degree in Computer Science field requiredPreferred Experience:Thorough understanding of Medicaid and healthcare standards like HL7, HIPAA and other standardsProven ability to analytically address complex problems, process critical data, establish facts, and draw quality conclusions.Ability to work well under pressure, with tight deadlines and ambiguity on some projects.We actively practice the philosophy that empowered employees make successful teams.
