Name: Business Analyst - MCT
Description: OverviewIMPAQ International, a growing and dynamic research and analytics firm, provides high-quality technology solutions in support of research and impact evaluations, policy analyses, survey research, organizational development, technical assistance and consulting services to U.S. and international government agencies, foundations, and the private sector.  IMPAQ’s mission is to bring together exceptional people to develop innovative and rigorous approaches to evaluate the real-world impact of social policies and programs. IMPAQ offers five locations: our Corporate Headquarters in Columbia, Maryland, rated one of America’s Best Small Cities; Downtown Washington, D.C., Boston, Massachusetts, a Bay Area office in Oakland, California and Seattle, Washington. IMPAQ has a diverse and collegial work environment. Job Profile The Business Analyst will support the business and technical managers in the defining the requirements and design of the CMS Medicare Coverage Tools (MCT). They will provide integral support in the requirements determination, conceptualization, design, development, testing, verification and validation, documentation, and implementation of information systems or applications. They will participate in defining system objectives and prepare system requirements and design specifications to meet user requirements and satisfy interface problems.  Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the U.S. on a full-time basis. Employment-based visa sponsorship (including H-1B sponsorship) is not available for this position.ResponsibilitiesWork with customer, users, and other contractors to gather, understand and document business, functional, technical & non-technical requirementsConduct Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions, work group calls and engage customers to provide requirements and feedbackConduct user research and usability testingCoordinate with Systems Engineers to assess impact to technical solutionsTrack and monitor contractual requirements against technical designsDevelop and sustain Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM)Develop Change Requests per established policies and proceduresDevelop user stories and requirement documents as per project standards and guidanceFollow agile methodology (Scrum/Kanban) and deliver requirements/specifications for Sprint teamsProvide clear qualitative and quantitative information to teams and stakeholdersWorking with development and testing team to implement requirements as per functional specificationsSupport change control processes established to monitor and control project scope QualificationsEducation, Knowledge, and ExperienceBachelor’s Degree in related field (Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration, Health Policy, Economics, or equivalent experience, required6 + years in leading requirements capture, management and analysis activities along all phases of the agile software development life cycle, including conducting user interviews, leading and facilitating JAD sessions, and developing business process models and formal specifications2 + years related experience in multiple disciplines including health policy, information systems, business, and/or technology fields.Excellent oral and written communication skills and must be detailed oriented.Must be able to effectively and professionally communicate to management, peers and customers as well as demonstrate sound judgment/reasoning skillsExpertise with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, etc.).Expertise with Agile tools like Jira, Confluence, Hipchat, Slack, Waffle and TrelloMust have intermediate to advanced skills with Microsoft ProjectExperience with manual testing of software products.Knowledge of flow charts and UML using Visio or similar tools will be plus.Knowledge of Visio or Sparx Enterprise Architect.Must be able to obtain a Position of Trust designationPreferred qualifications:Two (2) or more years of experience working with Federal Healthcare IT Projects.Knowledge of CMS Part C and/or Part D preferred.Knowledge of the CMS Medicare Coverage Tools preferred.PMP certification or Business Analyst certificationScrum Master (CSM) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certificationKnowledge of Healthcare, Medicare & Medicaid systems & dataKnowledge of Visio or Sparx Enterprise Architect.Must be able to obtain a Position of Trust designation

Name: Sr. Business Analyst, ServiceNow
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITIONUnder independent direction, the Sr. Business Analyst, ServiceNow assists in the development and delivery of technical and process oriented solutions and recommendations in support of the production environment. This includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of current system requirements, translation into proper system specifications, and writing and execution of test cases. The position is competent to work at a high level of most phases of systems analysis and considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current and future business environment. The position guides and advises less-experienced Production Support ServiceNow Analysts and works independently on application support projects of medium to high complexity.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESAssists in the development and delivery of technical and process oriented solutions and recommendations in support of the ServiceNow production environment. This includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of current system requirements, and translation into proper specifications for desired solution.Manages the execution of some aspects and/or phases of testing initiatives for moderate to large sized system implementations and/or application management projects. This includes writing and executing the test plan and test cases. Responsibility may include coordination of user acceptance testing.Collaborates within team to discuss issues and resolutions; provides status updates so others are informed of any implications that might affect them (e.g., trading implications). Provides direction and assistance to other ServiceNow Business Analysts regarding complex technical issues. Coaches and mentors users on applications, policies, and procedures.Writes low to moderately complex code, based on their translations of functional requirements and unit tests code to ensure proper functionality for business use. Assists in the estimation of the size of the effort required to complete the project based upon analysis of requirements of modules assigned; estimates costs and time allotment needed for a project.QUALIFICATIONSRequiredAdaptable and able to learn quicklyAbility to work both independently and in a team environmentStrong verbal and written communication skillsStrong interpersonal skills. Must be able to effectively work with people in the team, other IT departments and/or outside of the enterpriseMust be able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environmentDemonstrated advanced analytical and problem solving skillsDemonstrated ability to develop multiple solutions to moderately complex problems and recommend the best solution to the business and project teamAbility to translate functional business requirements into technical specificationsPreferredBS degree in technology related field preferredSome experience estimating development effort and scope preferredSome experience mentoring less experienced technical staff preferredPrior experience working in multiple technical environments preferredSome experience applying technical standards and change control policies and procedures preferredT. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Information Systems Technical Analyst (level 2 or 3)
Description: Your opportunities for achievement are limitless with Northrop Grumman Mission Systems. We are a team of professionals, collaborating to achieve our goals. As part of the Mission Systems Sector team you will join our experts in developing systems and solutions that keep our world safe. Together, we protect our troops, public safety, information, and our planet. It's unique work. It's challenging and rewarding. But most of all, it is work that makes a difference. Join us and launch your career. We'll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of global security. Northrop Grumman is seeking an Information Systems Technical Analyst. This position will be located at our Mission Systems Sector in Baltimore, Maryland. The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman's Visibility and Tools team to support Manufacturing Operations projects. We are seeking a highly motivated individual, with an eagerness to learn, and a passion for computer work. The selected candidate must have a willingness to explore new technologies independently and then develop them in a team environment. Roles and ResponsibilitiesSupport the Manufacturing Operations team by recommending/developing/ re-engineering visibility reports or tools to translate information in SAP into graphs and charts Analyze / Interpret data and convert to meaningful information for the business Utilize various toolsets such as SAP and Data Warehouse for data mining/data analysis Explore/develop new technologies or approaches to data mining and interpretation Create ad hoc reports based on unique business needs This req may be filled as a level 2 or a level 3 based on the qualifications below. MANUMSBasic Qualifications for the level 2:Bachelor's degree or higher in a STEM area (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) and 2 years of relevant experience (0 years with an MS) Experience in database or web programming, information systems or data management Must be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite.) Must be proficient in MS Office suite -Access, Excel, Project, Visio, PowerPoint Basic Qualifications for the level 3:Bachelor's degree or higher in a STEM area (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) and 5 years of relevant experience (3 years with an MS) Experience in database or web programming, information systems or data management Must be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite.) Must be proficient in MS Office suite -Access, Excel, Project, Visio, PowerPoint Preferred Qualifications:Experience in or knowledge of a manufacturing environment Experience with SAP and Tableau Familiarity with data transportation formats, including, but not limited to JSON, XML Experience with object oriented languages, such as JAVA, C# and database management languages such as SQL or statistical computing languages such as R Familiarity with modern web development stack (ASP.NET, MVC, JS Frameworks, CSS, HTML) Experience with database technologies including ORACLE and SQL Server Familiarity with AGILE development Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: About the Job:NewDay USA is looking for a top notch business mind and modeler to support our operations and business development initiatives. Working closely with Sales, Finance and Human Resources and reporting to the Vice President of Business Development, the Business Analyst will be responsible for financial planning, human capital modeling, business operation planning and process improvements.Responsibilities:Effectively solve and communicate critical operational and financial mattersContribute to the development and execution of NewDay USA’s strategic goals and objectivesPrepare and analyze financial statements and provide key business insightsEstablish and monitor human capital performance, goal development and incentive structureIdentify opportunities for NewDay USA to leverage cross-functional strengths and improve and streamline operational functions in the companyCreate business models and reporting capabilities for various branches of NewDay USAProvide analysis and execution of capital marketsAbout You:You have 3-5 years of finance and operational experience with a proven track record of creative problem solvingYou have a Business, Accounting or Finance degree and a M.B.A. or are currently enrolled in a M.B.A program from a top tier accredited UniversityYou have advanced skills in SQL and ExcelYou are experienced with change management in a high growth environmentYou are an analytical and decisive decision maker with the ability to prioritize and communicate tactics necessary to achieve organizational goalsAbout NewDay USA:NewDay USA is looking for extraordinary team members to help change the lives of America’s veterans and to be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Maryland. Our team is comprised of some of the most diverse, talented and energetic people anywhere in the financial services industry. They are also driven to excel by the exceptional opportunities for growth and advancement that are unique to NewDay USA. Join one of the fastest growing companies voted a “Top Workplace for Career Training” by The Baltimore Sun, and a “Top Entry Level Employer” by CollegeGrad.com.

Description: Salisbury Management Inc. At Salisbury Management, Inc. Our job is to allow the companies we serve do what they do best which is provide quality care to their patients, consumers and students. SMI is a recognized leader in offering professional, operational, and management services. Our goal is to provide a complete array of professional administrative services to companies that need to minimize the complexity of day to day administrative operations, so they can get to the business they do best by caring for the individuals they serve. understanding, and distinguish user request from the underlying true needs.Proactively communicate and collaborate with internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and identify areas that need improvement or updating.Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously as required.Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding on how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements in the healthcare industry.Serve as the IT Departments liaison between the business community, stakeholders and the IT team members through which requirements and specifications will flow.Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language.Collaborate with IT team needed.RequirementsMinimum Qualification & Skill:Bachelor’s Degree in IT/ computer Science or relevant work experience3 years of experience in Business/ System Analysis and Quality AssuranceHealthcare industry experienceProven experience in eliciting requirements and testingExperience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and toolsExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, staff and other subject matter experts.Experience in cost/benefit and ROI analysis.Be result oriented and have a record of success in meeting deadlines.Benefits Eligible Salisbury Management Employees will receive: Competitive pay, and benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)Employee Discount ProgramRewards program which allows you to earn points to purchase items401k options option Salisbury Management Inc. is an equal opportunity Employer. Healthcare experience is a plus  · Demonstrated ability to elicit, document, analyze and verify requirements.  · Experience in or expose to business process analysis, Work flow, task analysis, user acceptance testing and requirements analysis.

Name: Analyst
Description: Analyst in Baltimore, MD  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Individuals in those role are subject matter experts in the market they support and can solve complex problems without assistance. The ability to proactively solve problems and enact effective solutions has been mastered. Lastly, the Analyst is able to communicate effectively, at a high level, with all functional groups.  Enroll assets in markets, settle and/or shadow settle the compliance related to events or test events, report both asset and portfolio level compliance internally and externally, and complete customer payments.  Report out the relevant financial impact of market operations with the highest level of accuracy. This includes both internal and external reporting.  Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers  Excellent computer proficiency (MS Office Word, Excel, Access and Outlook)  Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary customer service  Excellent attention to detail  Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines, and standard accepted practices  Ability to work as well with other members of the team to accomplish assigned tasks  Strong mathematical skills and the ability to apply these concepts to practical business situations  Energy industry experience preferred (2-4 years).  BS or BA degree in business related field such as Marketing, Finance, Management, or Economics required  Advanced degree in a business related field such as Master of Business Administration, Marketing, or Finance is preferred  Send resume to blea@latitudeinc.net

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: OverviewPublishing Services, an Agora company, is looking for a Jr. Business Analyst to join their team in Mt. Vernon, Baltimore, MD.  The Jr. Business Analyst will support cross-functional teams throughout The Agora Companies by gathering technical business requirements and providing direction to their business for system enhancements and projects. This role will require duties such as research, documentation, implementation, end-user training, assistance with system updates, communication across Publishing Services and the Agora, development of project request forms, coordination with ACS (external software vendor), and development of user’s guides.  The Jr. Business Analyst will also be responsible for assisting the Product Director with product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle including: gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision, and working closely with the Client Services team, Publishing Services Management team, Software Development team and The Agora users to ensure customer satisfaction.  You can learn more about Publishing Services by checking out their“Workplace Highlight” blog post.ResponsibilitiesWork closely with stakeholders to keep projects on-track.Gather and develop business requirements from fellow team members, other Publishing Services application teams, and coworker.Analyze tradeoffs between usability and system requirements.Translate business requirements for both technical and non-technical support teams clearly and concisely.Produce documentation for QA team to assist in development of test cases.Translate technical requirements for end user documentation and assist in production of audience-appropriate training material.Prepare user-friendly release notes to accompany each release.Verify development tasks have been completed according to requirements before release.Carry out duties according to priority and submit necessary documentation in a timely fashion with respect to explicit and implicit deadlines.Communicate status updates throughout development cycles.Develop and maintain clear standards for requirements documentation.Complete Operational Reviews. QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.Experience developing, supporting and maintaining software applications.Comfortable assisting with the design efforts of large software development initiatives.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Creative thinker.Excellent teamwork skills.Positive attitude and a constant learner.Expectations of the Jr.Business Analyst, ERP Product Team:Constant learner, questioning everything in a relentless pursuit of better technical solutions to complex problems.Strong work ethic, willing to go above and beyond to solve the problem and help the customer realize success.Great interest in the latest marketing/software trends and in what they can achieve for their business.Clear and concise communicator regardless of medium or purpose.Punctual in all tasks and duties.If interested, please submit a resume and cover letter to the link provided.About Publishing Services At Publishing Services, they create, customize, and manage the enterprise applications suite that support The Agora Companies. Their passion and progressive ingenuity has shaped and strengthened the marketing industry at large.  Their inventors address the diverse needs of their clients through customization and innovation. If a vendor's technology doesn't quite cut it, they’ll buy it, break it down for parts, and rebuild it. When the technology simply does not exist, they build it from scratch. Publishing Services’ proprietary systems have changed the landscape of media and digital marketing, elevating their clients as industry front runners.  The support teams at Publishing Services partner with clients to implement and manage their applications, optimizing key business functionality and allowing them to focus on making money...hand over fist.  Here, you can explore a cutting-edge market, discover your career, and accumulate extensive experience with the best in the business.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: *Responsibilities:** The Business Analyst will solicit, understand, and document the customer's business requirements, processes and workflows developing both written and visual depictions of requirements and process flows. The analyst is expected to also work with developers to create the functional specifications that meet those requirements, serve as a subject matter expert to the developers building those functions, and work with the QA team to test the developed functionality. This role works closely with other BAs, Developers, Testers, and Production Support through each stage of the software development lifecycle and also demonstrates both existing and new functionality to the customer stakeholders. This job requires an experienced analyst who can collaborate effectively with all levels of the organization, proactively identify and resolve problems, and make challenging decisions. The candidate will be responsible for recommending and instituting business analysis best practices, tools and methodology towards standardization of deliverables and procedures, and collaborating with Development and QA Leads to uphold and improve Agile processes. *Skills Required:** ? Understanding of business analysis principles, processes, and techniques.  ? Written and verbal communications.  ? MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).  ? Bachelor's Degree or higher in technology-related field or relevant experience in implementing software in the Health industry.  ? Ability to prioritize and work on multiple assignments simultaneously. *Skills Preferred:** ? Ability to develop and prepare use cases, functional specifications, and technical requirements.  ? Ability to understand and represent the needs of the end user in a software development environment.  ? Consultative and advisory skills.  ? Experience working on software development projects using waterfall and/or agile methodologies is a plus.  ? MS Visio skills.  ? Prior experience working with projects other than HPMS at the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).  ? ITIL certification or Six Sigma Certification a plus. They provide consultative guidance in terms of strategy and process to our program directors and coordinators by leveraging our tools and best practices. Analysts are often assigned to multiple programs and must be available to support the program in many different capacities. Work with technology partner to develop these reports, including technical scope, design, development, debug and user-acceptance testing.Troubleshoot problems with creating reports to support reporting requirements, data and metric definitionsCompile and deliver data used to measure overall Program performance as well as individual Supplier performance on a daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly basisReconcile and manage data quality as necessary to resolve discrepancies and/or reconcile results. Utilize data to identify potential system issues.Learn to utilize the reporting tools utilized by our programs and provided by our Technology partnersGather questions and requirements from business stakeholders and translate into technical requirements.Work with program operations teams to ensure that data is being entered correctly and work with technology partner to develop enhancements which will improve reportsQualificationsIntermediate to advanced knowledge of MS ExcelMust have strong technical, organizational and communication skills (both written and verbal).Must have strong problem solving capabilities, strong analytical skills, be flexible and able to handle multiple tasks concurrentlyEducationB.S. in Computer Science, Business, or related major or equivalent business experience. Additional InformationAs a workplace, we focus on relationships with each other, our clients and our candidates - in fact serving others is one of our core values. We support open communication and recognize that giving constructive criticism can be even harder than receiving it. We appreciate the fearless and the passionate, who force us to be better. Name: Sales and Business Analyst
Description: OverviewThe primary objective of a Sales and Business Analyst is to prepare winning proposals.  Sales and Business Analysts report to the VP of Sales and Marketing.  Sales and Business Analysts are not expected to bill time.ObjectivesInterface with prospective clients in a positive, efficient, and meaningful mannerUses judgement appropriately to collect the right information at the right time and to develop the right artifacts, as neededGenerate artifacts and estimates for new projects, quicklyGenerate winning proposals, quicklySupport the VP of Sales and MarketingEnsure a successful handoff of deals to the development teamWork on other special projects as assignedRequirements Candidates for this position will have a background in the following: Business Analysis: some of our clients approach us without fully understanding how software can impact and improve their business operations. Business analysis is a necessary skill to have in order to design the most appropriate solutions for our clients.Sales: sales is an important aspect to the position, and someone that understands and has experienced the sales process will positively impact our businessshow results more quickly than otherwise. The ideal candidate will have experience managing various complex client relationships. We also prefer candidates with experience using CRM.Product Management: our clients come to us with projects that are on a spectrum of being poorly-defined to being well-defined. It is therefore critical to have product management experience in order to understand how to clearly define the features of the software we help our clients build.Software Development: someone that has experienced the nuance of software development firsthand will better understand the software development process. While the ideal candidate need not be a “rockstar developer”, we do prefer someone with more than cursory knowledge of software developmentBenefitsNever drive in rush hour traffic again: You only have to be in the office from 10 am to 3:30 pm. Fill in the rest of your 40 hours when you can. Plus we work remotely every other Friday. You can choose whether to get stuff done in the office, in your favorite coffee shop, or on your couch.Kiss stress goodbye: We have a constantly improving process for completing client work, which eases stress and streamlines all operations in the company.Go-Go gadget: Choose the hardware you want and we’ll make it happen.Chow down, on us: We’ve got a grocery budget. Just tell us what you want us to keep in stock and we'll get it. Breakfast? Nutella? It’s on. Plus, we provide company lunch once a week.Learn constantly: Our projects typically last a few months, which means you’ll quickly gain experience working with a variety of technologies.Engage with your community: SmartLogic helps to organize BohConf, Ignite RailsConf, Bmore on Rails, and sponsors tons of community events. Have ideas of what you’d like the company to support? We’re all ears.Choose your own team: Our interview process is based on maintaining the best culture for creating excellent technology. You will be interviewed directly by our developers. Before too long, you could be interviewing your next teammate. Work with people you know you can teach--and learn from--because you helped to choose them.Team up: Not only do we talk to each other all the time, we give more than lip service to working together and trading ideas. Beyond regularly pair programming, we hash things out at weekly company lunches.All the basics: We offer competitive pay, medical insurance, and paid vacation.Work in a great environment: We’re dedicated to providing office space that’s aesthetically and intellectually pleasing. We’re currently located in an office with tons of windows in Canton, where we’re surrounded by other technology companies.

Name: Quant Analyst
Description: Join the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce. Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits. Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 150 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon!PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION  As a key member of the Commercial Risk Organization, this position will require a thorough attention to detail and offer an opportunity for the employee to gain an in-depth understanding of the physical and financial products offered by the Company, as well as, the marketplace in which it transacts. This position is responsible for administering the Curve Governance processes for the commercial organization to ensure the adherence to established Risk Management policies and procedures largely associated with volatilities within the options portfolio. This role is vital to ensuring that all risks are properly identified, characterized, valued, and reported on a consistent and timely basis. The Curve Governance Analyst is responsible for the development of independent forward volatility and correlation curves utilizing broker, consensus and other external data to ensure proper risk reporting.  PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES 1. Draw on knowledge of programming in MATLAB, Python, R, C++, SQL, VBA, advanced statistical analysis, and financial modeling/derivatives valuation skills to develop and maintain the models that guide the companys financial and physical trading, portfolio management, and risk assessment activities. Responsible for Price verification which validates internal price curves (domestic and international markets) and volatilities by using market consensus data and broker quotes.Provide validation of financial controls related to curve marking in support of Constellations Sarbanes Oxley compliance, internal and external audits.Develop new volatility models (power, natural gas, emissions, and heat rates) and improve existing ones to better represent energy market uncertainties.Ensure accurate inputs (price-related and volatility/correlation inputs) that feed into Analytical Modelling Platform (portfolio modeling simulation engine used for transaction valuations, financial disclosures, and LRP and LE processes).Build and maintain quantitative modeling and statistical methods as needed.Provide explanations of the modeling and its results to front-office traders, pricing analysts, portfolio management, accounting, senior risk and commercial leaders.Design and evaluate appropriate risk metrics for internal and external disclosures.Monitor and respond to business needs by staying abreast of developments in the energy markets and within the organization and provide analysis/reports to meet those needs.Present risk metric reports at the Commercial Group Risk Committee monthly and at the Quarterly Review Meetings with Accounting quarterly. Qualifications POSITION SPECIFICATIONS Minimum:  Undergraduate degree in Finance, Engineering, Math, Accounting, Business or related quantitative discipline required.  1-3 years of experience in a business or quantitative related position.  Strong organizational and verbal communication skills.  Strong math and analytical skills with attention to detail.  Knowledge of MATLAB, Python, R, C++, SQL, and VBA programming.  Ability to challenge the status quo and confidence to independently challenge price and vol curve valuations.  Demonstrated ability to work closely with peers in a teamwork environment.  Preferred:  Masters degree in Finance, Engineering, Math, Accounting, Business or related quantitative discipline required.  Experience with financial or energy markets preferred.  DISCLAIMER  The preceding position description is intended to provide the general nature and level of work to be performed by employees within this classification. It is not intended to be a detailed description of the position or a comprehensive listing of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position, nor is it intended to indicate the exact amounts of time an individual will perform various position duties.  Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.  VEVRAA Federal Contractor EEO is the Law Poster

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: The Senior Business Analyst is part of the Professional Services (PS) team. PS is a team of highly motivated specialists with the specific skills and experience required to make sure that the implementation of our product at our customer's location goes ahead as smoothly as possible. The PS team also provides product training and implementation support services to all of our customers and partners. Every project has its own set of unique challenges that must be overcome, and PS team members must be able to think and react quickly to find a solution that works for everyone.  Our PS consultants work closely with partners and customers all over the world. They have the professional and personal skills required to develop, teach, support, and lead teams towards successfully delivering our enterprise solution and achieving their goals.  As part of the PS team you will report to the Operations Manager PS.  As a Senior Business Analyst at Backbase you work closely with our customers and the Backbase UX design and Development team. You are responsible for analyzing, capturing and prioritizing the requirements for the new customer experience initiatives of our customers.  This is a crucial role within the Backbase PS team, because you are in the driver seat to help our customers realize their customer experience vision. You have to manage customer expectations and help them to translate their vision into a project backlog that can be implemented within time and budget. The job comes with great responsibility and offers the opportunity to work side by side with our customers worldwide and guide them successful implementations with the Backbase product.  The senior Business Analyst is expected to: Gather define and prioritize requirements of the project in close collaboration with the client;Write functional requirements using use case specifications or user stories;Perform business process gap analysis and manage requirement change;Act as "product owner" for the project to guide the team making the right choices to maximize project & customer success;Configure the various customer experience building blocks using Backbase Portal Manager and Backbase Forms Studio.Your profile You need to be an excellent communicator and feel comfortable interacting with stakeholders at various levels. Organizational and cultural sensitivity are a must.  Skills & knowledge:  Essential: University education and degree (preferable business or IT related);Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role for full service internet bureau;Minimum of 5 years experience in a client facing position;Experienced with Web Content Management;Experienced with Digital Marketing Tools;Experienced in requirements management an/or process modeling;Knowledge of multiple development methodologies, e.g. RUP, Kanban, SCRUM, Waterfall;Excellent written and verbal skills in English;Perseverance and pragmatism to solve complex problems;Ability to work under pressure;Ability to work in a multicultural and international environment;Extreme flexibility about work location and willingness to travel abroad frequently, sometimes for long periods of time. Desirable: Experienced in business processes and forms solutions;Experience in Financial Services industry;Experienced with Digital Marketing;Experienced in requirement management tools;Experienced in project management tools;Experienced with e-commerce.Why Backbase? Whether or not you've heard of us, you and your friends have probably used some of the products we've created. Backbase accelerates the transformation of digital banking. From being a Dutch startup company five years ago, we are now an international market leader. Despite having a leading market position, we haven't lost our startup mentality and we're not done innovating just yet. Working in teams with highly talented and skilled professionals from all over the world, we share a drive to make things better, nicer, and more advanced. More than 400 specialists dedicate themselves to what we do best, which is transforming global financial services with inspiring, innovative solutions. At Backbase, we love to create outstanding experiences, not just for our customers and users, but for ourselves, and this is what motivates us to transform our industry by delivering our best work.

Name: Analyst
Description: Analyst: Business Intelligence/Competitive IntelligenceBulletin Intelligence, Remote- U.S.Bulletin Intelligence: A news-monitoring and analysis boutique within Cision, Bulletin creates bespoke, expert-curated briefings and dashboards for approximately 150 of the most demanding clients in the world; chief executives who are household names, and their Comms and other teams. Client contracts are for as much as $1mm per year. Annual client-retention rates are typically in the mid-90% range. Bulletin was acquired by Cision in March 2017. Location: Bulletin’s primary office is in Reston, VA. The company’s analysts are able to use the company’s cloud-based software to work anywhere in the U.S. that has a high-speed internet connection. Responsibilities: Our Analysts live at the intersection of digital information, public policy and markets and apply layers of sophisticated human judgment to the information explosion in order to deliver the essence of what our clients -- a who’s who of government and corporate leaders -- need to know to start their day.  Analysts work overnight, utilizing complex proprietary software, to scour tens of thousands of sources – mostly news, but also white papers, financial analyst reports, market research, business opportunities, etc. – and distill their core findings into quick-read briefing. Each briefing service is created specifically for each client, focused on (if govt) its unique mission and (if corporate) its company, competitors and industry.  Successful analysts distinguish between critical, important and non-essential information and must be able to provide insightful briefings that allow senior business executives to begin their day fully prepared. You will be part of a top team using cutting-edge technology in order to research and analyze changing events and information trends. Qualifications:Excellent writing and editing ability.Strong skills in competitive-intelligence analysis.Understanding the information needs of chief executives and their teams.Excellent computer skills and comfort learning advanced technical tools.Ability to work overnight and under tight deadlines.Demonstrated intellect and curiosity, often via a bachelor’s degree from a leading university; MBA, JD or industry-specific advanced degree helpful.US citizen or permanent resident.A plus: fluency in any non-English language often used in business. Bulletin Intelligence and Cision are Equal Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity and sexual orientation or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Human Resources at Recruiting@Cision.com.  Company Insights:Seamless, cloud-based workComprehensive health benefitsFlexible time off (PTO) programCasual dress codeFree parkingClose to Wiehle Metro (VA)On-site gym and deli (VA)Formal quarterly reviews that facilitate your success About Cision: Cision Ltd. Name: Data Analyst
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success. If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price.PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITION The Data Analyst role is critical to ensure that USI Sales, Marketing, CRM, AUM, 3rd party, client purchased, Finance and Operational data are regarded as accurate, timely, reliable and trusted by business stakeholders. The Data Analyst accomplishes this goal by 1) Proactive monitoring and management of critical data sets, 2) Detect data anomalies (e.g., accuracy and timing) and work with GBS DMS counterparts to enrich and repair, 3) Provide “Data on demand” to Sr. Data Analysts, BI Reporting leads, Sales Strategy Analysts and USI Sales and Marketing Associates 4) Support USI divisional reporting and analytical efforts through their daily functions and participate on project activities related to USI data stewardship and quality. The role collaborates with the Distribution Intelligence BI Reporting and BI Analysts, peer Data Analysts, MDM Data Stewards, SSA analysts, and other key stakeholders to implement and execute data quality and maintenance programs and activities for Distribution Intelligence’s various data sources in alignment with Global Corporate Data Governance policies and procedures. The Data Analyst possesses strong technical skills, business unit expertise and leadership. Responsible for standardizing data definitions, naming conventions, and monitoring overall data quality. Incumbent is charged with establishing confidentiality guidelines for data owned by their respective business unit; facilitates the interpretation and implementation of data policies and guidelines. This position assures data is classified in regards to sensitivity for information security purposes and is managed according to the data handling matrices that provides specific procedures, assuring data moves smoothly through the data life cycle (data collection and maintenance, and its access for current historical trend analysis. Also reviews and/or assists in the maintenance of business definitions in data models which diagram and document the above. PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESConsultation– Acts as the primary contact for the data management strategy and stewardship for various types of data used for Data on Demand as well as for the BI Reporting team . Uses advanced negotiation, oral and written communication skills to make technical and non-technical material understandable to business sponsors, and in providing analysis and recommendations for current and future needs which minimize redundancy and maximize compatibility of data within and across the USI operating and functional environments. Engages appropriate IT and business partners to help shape strategic direction for data management in order to reduce risks, costs and to create consistency and efficiency.Governance – Defines and manages process and controls for the creation, consumption and/or destruction of data (specify types of data). Includes collaboration with senior IT and business managers to obtain strategic support for the governance policies. Trains data customers and business analysts to understand the data, including high-level education to senior management on data needs, trends and input for strategic direction. (e.g. daily NNF and trade reports)Quality Assurance – Incumbent provides highest level of quality assurance and data integrity. Applies regulatory standards and defines guidelines for data testing and usage. Creates and maintains documentation regarding data definitions, calculations, statistical reporting, usage and restrictions and will exercise influence and leadership when communicating guidelines to affected parties throughout enterprise. Continually tests data to ensure a seamless full cycle flow of information.Analysis & Project Support – Responsible to provide Data on Demand services for data under stewardship to SSAs as well as BI Reporting Team and USI Sr. Management. Participates in project related work by assuming responsibility for data integrity, which may entail resolving processing issues, instituting data polices or procedures, and working with the appropriate technical and/or subject matter experts.QUALIFICATIONSRequiredCollege degree and 1 year of related work experience, orAssociate degree and 3 years related work experience, orHigh School diploma/equivalent and 5 years related work experienceAt least 2 years experience in data management by one or a combination of the following: creating or maintaining complex databases; writing and executing reports to query databases; analyzing and presenting; serving as a data steward.Experience with the software development lifecycle and change controlHigh level of analytical and problem solving skillsLeadership and ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels, including external parties.Knowledge of database design terminology and SQL.Advanced communication skills, both verbal and written.Demonstrated ability to foster change and deliver business results using effective teamwork, communication and problem identification and resolution skills.Negotiation skills.Process oriented.PreferredBachelor’s degree and a minimum of 7 years related experiencePrior experience with Data Management Lifecycle MethodologyData management experience in financial services industryExperience with Alteryx and/or TableauExperience or knowledge of asset management distributions T. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

They provide consultative guidance in terms of strategy and process to our program directors and coordinators by leveraging our tools and best practices. Analysts are often assigned to multiple programs and must be available to support the program in many different capacities. Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITIONThe Senior Business Intelligence Analyst independently and proactively consults with business leaders to provide business insight, enabling key strategic business decision making processes. This position often works independently in developing custom BI reporting solutions in support of high priority strategic decision making as well as delivering on highly complex one-off BI reporting requests in support of time-sensitive Executive Leadership initiatives. This role also works independently to perform quantitative / statistical analysis and modeling on large and complex datasets in order to provide data-driven, actionable insight to business leaders. This role leverages depth of knowledge about the business units supported and advanced technical capabilities to handle these complex data, reporting, and advanced analytics needs. The one-off requests and projects will often require the Senior BI analyst to leverage multiple complex data sources to blend and analyze results. Project work involves translating business requirements and creating solutions from original concept, often with little guidance or documentation. The incumbent will work closely with the BI Senior Product Owner and Analyst team as well as key leaders within Individual Investors whom we serve. Incumbent is familiar with Agile practice and perform Scrum Master dutiesPRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESPerformance and Management DashboardsLeads the development of custom performance and management reports/dashboards in support of strategic decision making processes by utilizing the latest data visualization tools and techniques.Operates as a SME in data visualization and storytelling, providing both reactive and proactive consultative guidance for internal business partners .Independently coordinates new project requests once prioritized by the Sr. Manager, gathers documents, and translates business requirements for new reporting or modeling needs.Leverages knowledge of the business to develop business intelligence solutions. Train business users on the usage of these new reporting solutions and present any derived business insight with senior leadership to enable key business decisionsProactively identifies opportunities to improve and evolve existing business intelligence solutions. Present findings to senior leadership in formal settings to deliver insight into business performance and KPIs.Partner with Distribution Enablement to ensures data quality and integrity in all project deliverables. Emphasize strong UX design practices to ensure a positive user experience with all self-serve BI solutions.Business AnalyticsIndependently and proactively provide consultative analytical support for business partners across Client Experience, Sales, Marketing, Finance, Compliance, and Operations as it relates to existing and potentially new deliverables.Partner with business unit leadership to evaluate existing performance and management reporting / dashboards and provide more in-depth analytics on existing and new reports where applicablePerform analytics to identify key drivers to reporting outcomes and provide business insight to business leaders across Client Experience, Sales, Product Marketing, Finance, Compliance, and Operations.Lead presentations on analytical findings when necessary, providing data-driven business insight to enable important business decision making processesAnalytical Modeling & EnablementDevelops advanced analytic / quantitative models in support of key decision making processes as needed. Performs proactive exploratory analysis to generate unsolicited business insight.Works closely with Sr. Manager and the Data Scientists on analytical modeling projects. Name: SCHEDULER/Program Planning Analyst 4
Description: Northrop Grumman Mission Systems sector is seeking a SCHEDULER/Planning Analyst 4 to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Business Management team, supporting the Program Scheduling and Compliance (PS&C) Organization. This position is located in Linthicum, MD.  The SCHEDULER/Planning Analyst is responsible for the implementation of standard processes and tools and program planning and control practices. This position will work within a team environment consisting of program management, technical, production, financial and other supporting staff. The ideal candidate will have strong teambuilding skills, exhibit strong leadership potential, and possess comprehensive verbal and written communication and presentation skills. Roles and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:Ensure major Projects and Programs Integrated Master Schedules (IMS) and plans are horizontally and vertically integrated across company functional groups including finance, engineering, material, manufacturing, and quality.Utilize Gantt, PERT, milestone charts, earned value management and other project management techniques to gauge progress and identify performance variances to facilitate focus and intervention on critical areas.Engage with the Program Team to perform thorough project analysis showing knowledge and understanding of the program and the principles of EVMS, and suggests/creates/implements work around to enhance cost and schedule performance.Perform risk analyses, and identify and resolve critical path and network logic conflicts.Understand numerous facets of scheduling and contribute to the development of new scheduling concepts, techniques and standards.Provide interface/support to program office, IPT leads/CAMs and less experienced schedulers to achieve program objectives.Support new business proposal providing recommendations on schedule methodologies and proposal strategies and develop an IMP and IMS.RELOCATION ASSISTANCE MAY BE AVAILABLE ON THIS REQUISITIONBasic Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Industrial Engineering, Finance, Operations Management, Mathematics, Computer Science or related field with 10 years' related professional experience -OR - a Master's degree with 8 years' related professional experience.Other degrees may be considered if coupled with extensive related skills and experienceAn additional 4 years of experience may be accepted in lieu of degree.6 years of project scheduling experience using Microsoft Project or other related scheduling tools.Experience with Schedule Health Analysis tools and Schedule Risk Assessment tools.6 years of experience using MS Office Suite, specifically Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.Willingness and ability to travel domestically 10% of the time.A current, active US Secret Level security clearance is required.Preferred Qualifications:Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration:10 or more years of scheduling experience and expert proficiency in Microsoft Project or other related scheduling tools as demonstrated by an understanding of the tool's properties and functions, including:exports and imports,multi-project consolidation,inter-project linkage,ability to create a variety of views, tables, filters, and reports.Demonstrated expert knowledge when using Schedule Health Analysis tools and Schedule Risk Assessment toolsWorking knowledge of EVMS guidelines and processes.Top Secret clearance with eligibility for SCI. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe have an immediate need for experienced Business Analysts to join our growing team. Our analyst needs stretch across the organization performing in the capacity of Product Management, Professional Services and Customer Experience. As a liaison between our customers and development teams, the Business Analyst is pivotal in identifying business challenges/opportunities and defining solutions while remaining customer focused and engaged during the entire lifecycle.  Key Job Responsibilities  ²Highly driven in achieving results and quality of project deliverables. Strong technical aptitude and business intelligence to navigate projects from inception to completion.  ²Build strong business relationships with customers, SMEs, leaders, and development teams to collaborate in successfully solving business needs using basys technologies.  ²Identify business problems, recommend viable solutions and create or improve documentation in support of the solution.  ²Analyze requirements to facilitate the design and development of features, interface and screen designs, wireframes, and functional testing efforts. Constructs workflow charts/diagrams. Studies system capabilities and documents specifications.  ²Leverage experience to assess scope of work, support development and managing of project timelines. Work constructively with varying stakeholders to prioritize requirements and releases accordingly.  ²Monitor and communicate project progress with internal and external stakeholders through status reports. Name: Discovery Analyst
Description: Company Description ThreatConnect® arms organizations with a powerful defense against cyber threats and the confidence to make strategic business decisions. Founded in 2011, ThreatConnect (then called CyberSquared) started servicing government agencies on specialized cybersecurity contracts while building its platform. Officially launched in 2013, the ThreatConnect Platform has grown to more than 20,000 users worldwide. Today, ThreatConnect provides a suite of products designed to meet the threat intelligence aggregation, analysis and automation needs of security teams at any maturity level - built on the industry's only intelligence-driven, extensible security platform. Whether you want to work on building a world-class security platform or as a member of the services team, you will enjoy a career that truly makes an impact. For more information on the benefits of working at ThreatConnect, visit www.threatconnect.com/careers Job Description ThreatConnect is looking for highly motivated and experienced analysts with currently active U.S. Government Top Secret security clearances to fill positions on government contracts within the DC/NoVA/MD region. If you are sought after as an expert in your field and looking for a company that will both value and reward your expertise, take a look at what ThreatConnect has to offer. Requirements This position requires the ability to provide SIGDEV analytic support analyzing target technology trends, knowledge of essential client tools for discovery, DNI, tasking, and reporting. Applicant should advanced networking knowledge, strong layer 3 knowledge, and the ability to support network operations.  The candidate should have a solid background in several of the following: Network applicationsStrong writing and verbal skillsNetworking protocolsWorking knowledge of TCP/IP networksLog and packet-level tool experienceNetwork attack techniquesOperating system platforms (e.g. UNIX, Linux, Microsoft Windows)Network intrusion analysis and incident responseC/C++/Python/Perl Programming  Preferred certs: Network+ and/or CCNA  Clearance required: TS/SCI with favorable polygraph Benefits We work hard to reward our employees for their hard work. We offer a competitive benefits package with comprehensive insurance coverage, paid time off, and unique perks designed to help you meet your financial and personal goals.  We are committed to offering an employment experience and benefits package that enables you and your family to grow with us and to share in our success. We love to recognize our employees who have gone above and beyond, and offer incentives like quarterly awards, an employee bonus and referral program, and team-building outings. MEDICAL Full-time employees are eligible for health coverage effective from the first of the next month hired. The premiums are at no cost to the employee. We pay your premiums for individuals and families!  - Medical coverage  - Prescription drug coverage  - Dental coverage  - Vision coverage  - Company-paid short-term and long-term disability  - Company-paid life insurance and AD&D coverage FINANCIAL 401K retirement savings plan with company matching program of up to 6%.  Cell phone reimbursement WORK-LIFE BALANCE - 10 Paid Federal Holidays  - Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick time and holidays. 15 days (3 weeks) for new employees with the ability to accrue up to 25 days (5 weeks)  - Birthday day off  - Employee recognition program with quarterly awards  - Employee referral program of up to $5,000 per full-time hired referral  - Education Reimbursement program up to $5,250 for job-related college courses and professional training  - Company-provided refreshments at our Headquarters  - Quarterly events with your geographic team  - Annual company party

Name: Business Services Analyst
Description: Classified Title: Business Services Analyst  Working Title: ?????Business Services Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/04/PD  Starting Salary Range: $58,695 - $80,625  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: M-F, 8:30 am - 5:00 pm  Exempt Status: Exempt ???????  Location: 33-MD:Johns Hopkins Bayview  Department name: 10002783-SOM DOM Bay General Admin Chairmans Off  Personnel area: School of Medicine *General summary/purpose:** + The Business Services Analyst position assists in project management, data/financial analysis, and reporting for the Department of Medicine (DOM), Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center, and School of Medicine. The position aligns operations to meet the needs of patient care while also supporting the educational and research missions of the Department.  + The DOM maintains approximately 185 inpatient beds at Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center, discharges approximately 11,000 patients and sees more than 70,000 ambulatory visits. With a direct reporting relationship to the Sr. Administrator/Assistant Dean and project accountability to Division Administrators and the Finance/Operations Administrator, the Business Services Analyst is responsible for performing project management, research, and financial analysis in support of the Chairman?s Office, Vice Dean Program Office, as well as Divisions within DOM. The position will supervise interns and residents as well as coordinators and analysts. This job includes presentation and participation in executive meetings and leadership forums.  + The incumbent will coordinate at the Divisional, Departmental, and Hospital Executive level to advance the tripartite mission of research, education, and patient care. Sharing expertise and collaborating closely with a broad spectrum of individuals across the Hopkins enterprise, this position has a far-reaching impact touching patient care, business development, system integration, data analytics, quality improvement, and more. *Specific Duties/Responsibilities:***Project Development/Management:** + Work with education, clinical, and research areas to meet operational targets and to help develop, implement and maintain performance improvement initiatives  + Assist in the development of business plans, financial analyses, market analyses, and other service analysis to evaluate and support strategic initiatives.  + Develop, implement and evaluate comprehensive project plans for identified opportunities ? establish project goals, objectives and outcomes as needed, secure leadership support and endorsement, determine a project timeline to accomplish identified goals with milestones, consider organizational needs by identifying necessary resources, and work with a team of project participants  + Lead, facilitate, and support meetings and committees as appropriate.  + Work collaboratively with physician, nursing and care management leadership to provide effective, efficient and patient-centered care in the Department?s clinical care settings  + As applicable, assist in the development of volume, expense and capital budgets?and corrective action and performance improvement plans?for the DOM?s Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center operations. *Hospital Operations:** + Routinely assess patient throughput (e.g., length of stay, discharge barriers, procedure/test delays, boarding hours, and referring hospital wait times) and, in partnership with Case Management, Social Work, Nursing Administration and faculty leadership, utilize process improvement methodologies to enhance and optimize performance and desired outcomes.  + Engage and partner with other department administrations to develop inter-departmental throughput and capacity solutions for Department of Medicine patients.  + Assist faculty and nursing leadership in the communication and implementation of existing, new and/or revised administrative policies, guidelines and protocols involving patient care operations.  + Assist in the coordination of Department response to internal disasters (e.g., flooding, facilities issues, etc.) and external emergencies (e.g. severe weather, international incidents, etc.)  + Assist in the development of strategies to maintain and improve compliance with all appropriate regulatory and accrediting bodies (e.g. HSCRC, The Joint Commission) in all areas of operations, including personnel management, facilities, workflows, etc.  + Ad hoc/short term operational projects as assigned. *Reporting/IT Systems:** + Utilize Outpatient/Inpatient Operation systems and databases (EPIC, IDX, DataMart, Case Mix, CCUB, Medvitals) to develop and maintain clinical reports detailing access performance, volumes, provider utilization, patient satisfaction, financial performance, safety, compliance and other pertinent decision support tools and management reports. Communicate reporting trends to Departmental and Divisional Leaders.  + Prepare timely and accurate ad hoc analysis/reports such as staffing level, physician productivity, space utilization, access/capacity, new clinical practice initiative, business plans, professional fee and hospital billing assessments and payer mix etc.  + Make recommendations to leadership based on data that is analyzed and develop presentations *Financial Management/Analysis:** + Assist in the development of the annual Departmental budget and projection. Responsible for assisting in control of established budgets by overseeing loading of budget, reconciling budget information and changes, and extracting and analyzing financial data to assist in management of the Department?s JHU & JHB operations  + Perform comprehensive financial analysis relating to business plans to improve Departmental financial effectiveness and compliance with JHU, JHH and/or agency regulations and restrictions  + Assist in developing business plans for revenue enhancement or new lines of business. Evaluate the financial performance of existing programs and create financial performance reports. Develop financial proposals for programs as needed.  + Oversee Joint Administrative Agreement including monthly transfers, reconciliation and changes.  + Partner with at least one Division to maintain consistency of financial practices as well as implement/maintain a vision of overall DOM financial goals.  + Expectation to investigate and perform constant financial improvement/projects in areas of interest.  + Train new and existing finance staff to complete monthly financial reporting requirements and the annual budget. Meet routinely with Department and Division leadership to share financial results, discuss areas of improvement, and propose plans to address weaknesses. *Minimum qualifications:** + Bachelor?s degree in Health or Business Administration required. Master?s degree preferred.  + Three years health care experience required.  + Understanding of medical operations and physician practice management as usually acquired in 3-5 years applicable experience.  + Working knowledge of information systems, revenue cycle, communication skills, plus advanced analytical ability to identify data requirements, and analyze complex reports. *Special knowledge, skills, and abilities:** + Requires the ability to compile, analyze and interpret patient /physician data.  + Must be able to present and format data and technical information for various end users.  + Must have solid project management skills.Ability to make independent judgments and to act on decisions on a daily basis.  + Ability to work for long periods of time without direction.  + Ability to prioritize own work and work of staff as needed.  + Ability to work with flexibility on several tasks simultaneously and to meet various concurrent deadlines.  + Excellent communication and customer service skills with the ability to work well under pressure.  The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu . For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. *The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.** During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. *Equal Opportunity Employer** Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled. *EEO is the Law**Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm Equal Opportunity Employer: Johns Hopkins University is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria. The university promotes affirmative action for minorities, women, disabled persons, and veterans.

Name: Jr-Business Analyst

Such positions provide training and the prospect of future advancement. Entry-level business analysts work under supervision and perform a variety of tasks including developing and maintaining various databases, generating reports, and receiving continuous training while working on a variety of projects.The primary responsibility of an entry-level business analyst includes supporting data gathering and providing review and analysis of data.
