Name: Sr Business Analyst, Fund Product Management
Description: Our mission as a leading investment management firm is to help our clients achieve their long-term financial goals. We believe our associates are the key to this mission and we are always looking for talented individuals who share our commitment to our client’s success.If you’re looking for challenging work experiences and the ability to learn in a collaborative culture, we invite you to explore the opportunities available at T. Rowe Price. PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITIONThe Senior Business Analyst’s primary role within Fund Product Management - North America (FPM-NA) is to lead small-to-medium scale initiatives related to the T. Rowe Price Mutual Funds (Funds), T. Rowe Price Common Trust Funds (Trusts), or other investment products (collectively, the “Products”). In leading these initiatives, the Senior Business Analyst will work closely with stakeholders across the firm including investments, sales, client servicing, reporting, and accounting. The Senior Business Analyst will also continue to provide project and research support to FPM-NA managers. The incumbent must be able to act independently, make certain business decisions, and collaborate with business partners and project teams to influence and advance initiatives. This role will provide intrinsic value to the organization, as the incumbent will lead certain initiatives, train analysts, enhance policies and procedures, and spearhead improvement processes that will allow FPM-NA to continue to efficiently manage initiatives and product related tasks.PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIESProject Leadership – Leads small-to-medium scale initiatives that promote FPM-NA activities such as managing the operational aspects of new product launches and mergers/transitions; creating and enhancing policies and procedures of the Products; educating other business units on the Products’ policies and procedures; leading end-to-end process reviews; and implementing other product-related changes. For each initiative, the Senior Business Analyst will be expected to identify the objectives and goals, manage the project planning and any related documentation, make substantive decisions, and provide direction to team members. The incumbent will lead certain discussions with business partners across the firm’s operations, distribution, investment, and corporate divisions to drive these initiatives to a successful completion.Business Analysis and Support - Assists FPM-NA Managers by researching new or existing investment strategies, business processes, or regulatory developments in support of department initiatives. Coordinates the collection of information, identifies key trends, and presents such information to FPM-NA managers in a concise and professional format. Facilitates meetings with business partners for the purpose of eliciting and documenting business requirements from which products, services, and tools are developed. Validates that requirements and assessment of risk elicited match the stakeholder’s understanding and meets their needs. Acts independently with minimal supervision, identifies potential risks to FPM-NA and/or the firm’s business-as-usual operations, and elevates issues to management when necessary. Works with FPM-NA Managers on the development of product-related recommendations to both mid-level and senior staff.Infrastructure Development and Support – Develops and evolves team and client reference resources. Researches new tools and technologies that may benefit the operations of the team such as SharePoint to enhance FPM-NA’s project tracking and execution. Develops and leverages metrics to analyze and measure the effectiveness and outcomes of projects, initiatives, and product launches. Develops standard documentation for FPM-NA-led initiatives to enhance processes and improve effectiveness.Board and Product Administration – Assists with the preparation of board materials. Provides on-going product support for investment vehicles such as supporting a benchmark change, managing a fund name change, or adding a new share class. Determines opportunities to improve reporting process, interacts with other business units to design and gather requirements, and then coordinates the implementation of such reporting enhancements for use within the group and by other cross-functional teams.QUALIFICATIONSRequiredCollege degree and 2 years of related work experience, or Associate degree and 4 years related work experience, or High School diploma/equivalent and 6 years related work experienceBroad experience of the financial industry including mutual funds and/or other investment vehicles offered by T. Rowe PriceAbility to apply acquired knowledge from prior experience effectively in new situationsSelf-motivatedPositive approach to work and ability to work with all levels of the organization as neededAbility to work in an extremely fast-paced, high volume environment that calls for constantly changing prioritiesCustomer service orientationStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work collaboratively with others in team environmentAbility to effectively facilitate cross-functional/cross-site conversationsAbility to effectively communicate with high level internal and external contactsExperience communicating financial mattersAbility to develop and manage effective relationships at all levels of the organization and work collaboratively with others in a team environmentLogical thinker with strong attention to detailAbility to think strategically and creativelyOutstanding and demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills, both qualitative and quantitativeAbility to translate business needs into functional requirementsAbility to develop multiple options to address identified, moderately complex business issues or needsProcess oriented with proven process improvement experience and ability to create detailed, end-to-end processesStrong project management skills including project planning, documentation, and follow-through Demonstrated ability to independently lead and execute projects of small to medium complexity with various stakeholdersAbility to organize, prioritize, and manage multiple tasks and/or initiativesExperience using Microsoft Office Suite - Superior PowerPoint skills and advanced Excel skillsSkilled in the use of Visio or other process or flow chart toolsWorking knowledge of software and databases such as Morningstar Direct, SIMFUND, Lipper, FactsetKnowledge of and experience with testing conceptsPreferredExperience with investment product operations, processes, and systemsKnowledge of TRP distribution unit clients and servicesKnowledge of relational databases such as Microsoft AccessInvestment product and market/competitor data experienceT. Rowe Price is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Senior Treasury Analyst - White Marsh
Description: Are you an analytically minded self-starter who thrives in an entrepreneurial environment? Do you have experience in treasury operations, forecasting, and financial analysis? If so, Mariner Finance Headquarters has a unique opportunity to join our Treasury Department as a Senior Treasury Analyst!  Become a part of growing & dynamic company and join a Treasury team that offers an opportunity for accelerated professional growth! If you are intellectually curious and thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, we would love to hear from you! Job Responsibilities:Provide on-going financial analysis support to senior and executive leadership.Provide financial result summaries and recommendations to drive managerial decision making.Performs complex cash management and cash forecasting duties.Perform complex departmental tasks as required, including but not limited to, creating new financial instrument models, frequent work associated with complex debt facility/warehouse drawdowns, repayments, asset repurchases, heavy SQL knowledge and utilization will assist in being successful.Provide input and enhance financial processes that support management, including annual operating plan, and monthly roll-forwards.Manages complex projects within the department and across organization ensuring timely completion, expert analytical interpretation, and summarization of results.Utilize SQL Server databases by developing queries, views, and various functions in order to provide detailed analytics and financial reporting.Provide custodial analysis and collateral reporting for securitized assets.Assists with mergers and acquisitions due diligence and integration post acquisition.Manages daily, weekly, and monthly servicing reports to include, but not limited to; Asset Backed Lending, ABS securitization, acquisition financing, daily cash management.Acts as key liaison across multiple business units on interpreting existing finance legal documents for recurring reporting and compliance requirements, etc.Collaborate across multiple business units to ensure liquidity forecast captures business activity timing future cash flow needs and ensure proper funding of accounts based on forecasted activity.Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Economics, and/or Finance. CPA, CFA and or Master’s degree preferred.SQL knowledge and experience highly preferredThree (3) to five (5) years of successful and progressive experience designing, developing, and implementing highly complex financial models.One (1) to Three (3) years of experience in Capital Market Operations.One (1) to Three (3) years of experience in Treasury Operations.Experience and proficiency with building advanced financial models for the purposes of providing efficient and automated reporting solutions.Advance knowledge and experience working in Excel (Modeling/Macros preferred).Successfully demonstrates, through prior experience and on-the-job, effective human relations and interpersonal skills and a participative team oriented style.Ability to handle multiple work steams at once in a fast-paced environment with a strong emphasis on attention to detail and timely completion.Possess and demonstrates well developed analytical and presentation skills to both evaluate information, concepts, and practices and to successfully convey to others in their terms the import and impact of financial activities on business plans and objectives.Experience with Goldpoint Services and other loan management systems preferredExperience or General knowledge of Accounting GAAP conceptsBenefits: As a team member of Mariner Finance you will enjoy a robust benefits package that demonstrates our dedication to employee satisfaction: Competitive Salary  Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurances  401k Match Paid Time-Off Education Reimbursement Flexible SpendingMariner Finance is a leading lending company founded in 2002 by a group of leading experts in the consumer finance industry. Mariner Finance was established to provide customers with creative, flexible, and convenient lending options. At the core of Mariner Finance is the principle that superior customer service is the driving force behind building lasting relationships. Mariner Finance is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender identity, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental handicap, covered veteran status, or other status protected by applicable law.

Name: Malware Analyst
Description: Whether youre diving into x86 disassembly, understanding advanced rootkit techniques, or overcoming the latest anti-reversing and obfuscation techniques - consider growing with our team of experienced analysts to help us figure out how and why adversaries attack systems and networks. At Fortego, you will embark on a journey of exciting, impactful & highly technical work with good people that treat you like family.If this is up your alley, and youve got the skills listed below with a TS/SCI with a Polygraph, we encourage you to apply. We will contact you within 3 business days of your application.As an ideal candidate, you will have any of the following skills...IDA Pro, WinDbg, OllyDbg, Immunity DebuggerStrong knowledge of C/C++, Windows API, and Windows OS internalsReconstruct unknown file formats & data structuresReconstruct unknown TCP/IP protocolsUnderstand unpacking, deobfuscation, and anti-debugging techniquesPython, Perl, Ruby scriptingAbility to write technical reportsRequired qualifications...TS/SCI with a PolygraphLooking for junior, mid, senior level analystsThe benefits...Rewarding your hard work: Referrals, sign on, profit sharing, quarterly awards need we go on? Generous training budget: Designed by you. PTO that has your back: For the families and the unbounded adventures, from furloughs to inclement weather, we are there. Top-notch health care and 401k package: If these drive you, this is your stop. Something always going on: Team lunches, happy hours, fantasy leagues, game nights, homebrew competitions and monthly family events. We support innovation: Got an idea? Want to learn something new? Whatever it is we will help see it through.About FortegoFortego helps solve some of the most difficult cyber issues the world faces today. Our employees spend their working hours deep in the trenches handling the most critical and exciting challenges on the national security front. As for the other hours of the day, you will find Fortego employees kicking back and enjoying benefits that span from family activities to sporting events, supporting veterans in the community, and exploring new tech. Fortego is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Principal All Source Analyst
Description: Req ID 101842BR  Business Title Principal All Source Analyst  Group MCIS  Location USA MARYLAND Fort Meade  Clearance Level Needed TS/SCI  Category Intelligence  Job Duties and Responsibilities Entering ManTech’s 50th year, we hold the distinct honor of being named a “Top 100 Global Technology Company” by Thomson Reuters. We have earned this and many other accolades over the years for our dedication to serving the missions of our nation’s most important customers: U.S. Intelligence, Defense and Federal Civilian agencies. All know us as a trusted partner offering best-in-class solutions in cyber, data collection & analytics, enterprise IT, and systems and software engineering tailored to meet their specific requirements.Become an integral part of a diverse team in the Mission, Cyber and Intelligence Solutions (MCIS) Group. Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, mission oriented Principal All Source Analyst in the Ft. Meade, MD area, with strong Customer relationships. At ManTech, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.The IMS Division provides cyber solutions to a wide range of Defense and Intelligence Community customers. This division consists of a team of technical leaders that deliver advanced technical solutions to government organizations. Our customers have high standards, are technically adept, and use our products daily to support their mission of protecting national security. Our contributions to our customer’s success is driving our growth.Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Provide support to the Force Protection team to identify intelligence gaps concerning current and emerging threats, and develop intelligence information report evaluations, source-directed requirements, and collection requirements of emphases to focus collection activities against those gaps. Provide general military intelligence analysis and organizational expertise dealing with threats to the U.S Army/DoD interests worldwideConduct all-source research and threat analysis of counterintelligence, counterterrorism, force protection, and information operations of foreign military forces and their operations, capabilities, activities and trends to support all-source intelligence and threat production, particularly in the areas of threats to U.S. Army and DoD equitiesProvide support to counterintelligence investigation through liaison with Counterintelligence Agents and other members of the DoD and intelligence communityProvide record checks, data research and social networking analysis through the use of intelligence and law enforcement databases and search enginesProvide in - depth research regarding biographical intelligence in order to aid investigations, support subject interviews, and case developmentConduct research using social networking tools, digital mapping programs, and law enforcement database and research tools, to include Open Source (OSINT) and classified searchesAnalyze intelligence information to assess developments, trends, and threat implications through comprehensive knowledge of intelligence threat analysis to include forecasting and/or other analytical methodologiesAnalyze terrorist and Foreign Intelligence Entity (FIE) threats to U.S. Army Forces, programs and operationsProvide recommendations on techniques and innovative methods employed in threat analysis and protectionResearch and analyze military, political, economic, technical and other developments within assigned areas to conduct valid threat assessmentsIdentify intelligence gaps and assist in the development of intelligence collection programsAdvise team leaders and chain of command on intelligence findingsPlan, coordinate, and synthesize research to prepare all-source intelligence products and responsesEnsure products fulfill DA, DoD, and national – level intelligence requirementsBrief intelligence assessments and positions to senior civilian and Army personnelPosition Requirements: Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent and 10 years of related Intelligence Analysis experienceIn addition to analytic skills, have familiarity with CI operational and investigative concepts and procedures, so they are better able to provide relevant analysis to the CI agents and managers they support. (Familiarity with similar HUMINT or law enforcement operational investigative concepts may suffice). Examples of advanced knowledge and skills needed include familiarity with priority threat languages, regional and threat country expertise, and/or skills in technical espionage or terrorist tradecraft.Security Requirements: An active TS/SCI Security Clearance is required  Qualifications Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent and ten to twelve years of related experience.  Degrees Equivalent Experience/EducationBachelor's Degree Years of Experience 10-12 years w/Bachelors DegreeSee Qualifications Position Type Full-Time  Shift Day  Overview ManTech International Corporation is comprised of approximately 7,300 talented employees who use advanced technology to help government and industry meet some of their greatest challenges around the world. We adhere to the simple, no-nonsense values on which ManTech was founded more than four decades ago, aligning squarely with the mission objectives of our customers. As our customer base continues to expand and diversify, we continue to diversify our workforce and solutions. Nearly half our employees have a military background, and approximately 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, health, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,100 active contracts with more than 50 different government agencies.

Name: Senior Business Process Analyst
Description: Job Description:Leidos is looking to improve and advance our organization. Our program is focused on the delivery of end-user centric IT technology solution to our Centers of Medicare and Medicaid (CMS) customer where we are challenged to provide ongoing innovative and seamless experience while using CMS systems, applications and solutions, provide proactive secure development of IT integrations, concepts, and designs across the CMS enterprise and integrate end-user computing devices, conference room technology, infrastructure hardware and software, and user applications into a streamlined and seamless experience across the CMS user base. We foster a positive end-user experience while ensuring protection of the data.AS Senior Business Process Analyst you will work closely with the program management and technical and engineering teams and provide evaluation and the analysis of the hardware and software products in support of the customer. Review trends and analyze the data to discover patters, identify areas of concerns and prioritize action steps to optimize program performance. You will work closely with external and internal customers to streamline the hardware and software ordering, delivery, tracking and reporting.Primary ResponsibilitiesList daily duties and/or specific job responsibilities. Under the direction of the Program and Deputy Program Manager, you will be responsible, to include, but not limited to:Management of the program Product Catalog.Streamline the ordering, tracking and continuous monitoring and reporting on the hardware and software delivered under the program.Work closely with the internal functional support teams and identify areas of improvements to deliver goods to the customer in the most efficient manner and act as a liaison between the program and the sub-contractors and vendors.Conduct evaluation of the software licensing currently on the program, identify different licensing options that will lead to cost reduction and faster delivery.Research best business practices within and outside the organization, collecting and analyzing process data to initiate, develop and recommend business practices and procedures that focus on increased productivity and cost reduction. Basic QualificationsList the "must have" MINIMUM requirements to be considered for the position and ensure minimum quals fall within the minimum Leidos job code requirements. Example: Bachelors' Degree with 6 years' of applicable experience or 4 additional years' of experience in lieu of degree. Must be able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI Clearance. Must have 2+ years JAVA experience. Bachelor's Degree with 8 - 12 years of relevant experience or Master's with 6-10 years of prior relevant experience. Additional years of work experience in lieu of degree is acceptable.Working knowledge of Leidos processes and systems.Experience working in Cognos, CostPoint, Hyperion and other financial and procurement systems.Experience in financial analysis and forecasting, review and analysis of invoices within contract and purchase order parameters.Experience with cost estimating, cost/benefit analysis, and the ordering, managing and tracking processes and procedures.Proficiency in budget and cost analysis tools.Advanced knowledge of Excel formulas and pivot tables.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated experience in developing and delivering briefings for senior and executive managers and facilitating high level technical discussions.All candidates supporting the CMS programs must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior in order to be considered.

Name: Sr. Systems Business Analyst
Description: The Senior Business Systems Analyst utilizes a variety of elicitation techniques to effectively gather pertinent information to plan, design, develop, and launch business, financial, and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. The BA must identify and create clear and concise alternative, constructive and forward thinking solutions for multiple business objectives and requirements. Recommended solutions will best fit the overall alignment with JHHC organizational goals. Solutions may include new applications, interfaces, architectures or process. The Sr. BA will be skilled in creating all supporting documentation and is able to create and utilize models and prototypes as required to solidify final requirements. The Sr. BA should be comfortable with both iterative/agile methodologies as well as traditional waterfall approaches to development. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, suability engineering and problem-solving skills to create final functional definitions ResponsibilitiesAbility to ascertain the true needs that will address tactical and strategic goals. He or she will be able to transfer information acquired from elicitation techniques into needed data and documentation. Statistics from other sources will be assessed and turned into usable information. The business analyst will be able to compile and report an easily understood projected vision to be implemented. Expert facilitation skills required.Must possess efficient analytical skills with proven ability to recognize patterns and create solutions for change in process workflow or reallocation of resources. Ability to both lead teams and work within teams to meet goals. Demonstrates a strong knowledge of one or more business areas and develops functional requirements and recommends operation process flows to meet business requirements and objectives.RequirementsEducation Bachelors degree in business. management, human resources, information systems, computer science, or another related field, or equivalent experience is required. A Masters degree in related field is preferred. Experience and SkillsMinimum of five years of experience working in a technology environment with mainframe, client server, or web based applications in the areas of requirements gathering, requirements definition and analysis, and business analysis, testing, or other general system support tasks. Additional experience should include project management and development skills through teamwork. Work experience should include roles as team member and team lead in a matrixed resource setting.

Name: Investment Banking 2019 Analyst Class
Description: Job Description:D.A. Davidson & Co., a leading full-service investment banking firm with operations nationwide, is accepting applicants for full-time Analyst positions working with the firm’s Investment Banking Group. The Analyst is expected to play an import role working with senior bankers on strategic assignments assisting clients with mergers and acquisitions, public offerings, private placements and other advisory services. The Analyst is expected to commit such time as is necessary to effectively fulfill their responsibilities, which will require a demanding schedule at times, depending on transaction and other activity.  Required Experience:QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Accounting, Economics, Finance, Mathematics or closely related field. Minimum 3.5 GPA.Some investment banking or transaction experience in related fields such as accounting, consulting or corporate finance required.Working knowledge of business software (especially Word, Excel and PowerPoint).General level of financial knowledge (financial modeling, macroeconomics, current events, etc.).Excellent verbal and written communications skills.Good judgment in confidential situations and ability to exercise discretion when handling confidential information.Strong work ethic and teamwork skills.High motivation, with a strong desire to excel in a challenging field.Ability and willingness to work long hours, nights, and weekends.Upon hiring, the successful completion of the FINRA Limited Representative-Investment Banking Exam (Series 79) and the Uniformed Securities Agent State Law Exam (Series 63).DutiesPrepare research/analytical content for pitch books, memorandums, presentations and other projects.Develop financial modules to analyze a wide variety of client-specific projects.Support business development activities of senior investment bankers.Attend client meetings.Interact with clients on transactional and technical issues. Keyword: Analyst  From: D.A. Davidson Companies  Apply now

Name: Business Analyst I
Description: Share PrintJob DescriptionProject DurationContract-to-Hire, 6 MonthsResponsibilitiesRespond to escalated service desk tickets, related to application troubleshooting. For example, when trying to submit a claim, there is an error in the UI.Connect with the internal and/or external stakeholder to discuss their issue and document the steps which they took in producing the error.Perform a root cause analysis of the issue, working with the technical team to produce a resolution.Perform trend analysis of recurring issues; write a requirements document to enhance the application to remediate the ongoing issue.Work with the technical team to remediate application issuesRequired SkillsJunior level business analysis experience; ability to write business cases for stakeholdersExperience working in a web application environmentCustomer service skills; ability to ask sophisticated questions of user issues.Strong writing skillsPreferred SkillsHelp desk ticketing system experience ServiceNow would be a bonusExperience in the insurance domain, or other highly regulated industrynTech is an equal opportunity employer. All offers of employment are contingent upon pre-employment drug and background screenings. Only candidates who meet all of the above client requirements will be contacted by a recruiter.

Name: Sales and Business Analyst
Description: OverviewThe primary objective of a Sales and Business Analyst is to prepare winning proposals.  Sales and Business Analysts report to the VP of Sales and Marketing.  Sales and Business Analysts are not expected to bill time.ObjectivesInterface with prospective clients in a positive, efficient, and meaningful mannerUses judgement appropriately to collect the right information at the right time and to develop the right artifacts, as neededGenerate artifacts and estimates for new projects, quicklyGenerate winning proposals, quicklySupport the VP of Sales and MarketingEnsure a successful handoff of deals to the development teamWork on other special projects as assignedRequirements Candidates for this position will have a background in the following: Business Analysis: some of our clients approach us without fully understanding how software can impact and improve their business operations. Business analysis is a necessary skill to have in order to design the most appropriate solutions for our clients.Sales: sales is an important aspect to the position, and someone that understands and has experienced the sales process will positively impact our businessshow results more quickly than otherwise. The ideal candidate will have experience managing various complex client relationships. We also prefer candidates with experience using CRM.Product Management: our clients come to us with projects that are on a spectrum of being poorly-defined to being well-defined. It is therefore critical to have product management experience in order to understand how to clearly define the features of the software we help our clients build.Software Development: someone that has experienced the nuance of software development firsthand will better understand the software development process. While the ideal candidate need not be a “rockstar developer”, we do prefer someone with more than cursory knowledge of software developmentBenefitsNever drive in rush hour traffic again: You only have to be in the office from 10 am to 3:30 pm. Fill in the rest of your 40 hours when you can. Plus we work remotely every other Friday. You can choose whether to get stuff done in the office, in your favorite coffee shop, or on your couch.Kiss stress goodbye: We have a constantly improving process for completing client work, which eases stress and streamlines all operations in the company.Go-Go gadget: Choose the hardware you want and we’ll make it happen.Chow down, on us: We’ve got a grocery budget. Just tell us what you want us to keep in stock and we'll get it. Breakfast? Nutella? It’s on. Plus, we provide company lunch once a week.Learn constantly: Our projects typically last a few months, which means you’ll quickly gain experience working with a variety of technologies.Engage with your community: SmartLogic helps to organize BohConf, Ignite RailsConf, Bmore on Rails, and sponsors tons of community events. Have ideas of what you’d like the company to support? We’re all ears.Choose your own team: Our interview process is based on maintaining the best culture for creating excellent technology. You will be interviewed directly by our developers. Before too long, you could be interviewing your next teammate. Work with people you know you can teach--and learn from--because you helped to choose them.Team up: Not only do we talk to each other all the time, we give more than lip service to working together and trading ideas. Beyond regularly pair programming, we hash things out at weekly company lunches.All the basics: We offer competitive pay, medical insurance, and paid vacation.Work in a great environment: We’re dedicated to providing office space that’s aesthetically and intellectually pleasing. We’re currently located in an office with tons of windows in Canton, where we’re surrounded by other technology companies.

Name: Business Analyst Contract
Description: Our client, a regional health insurance provider, is looking for a Business Analyst to join their team in Owings Mills.Responsibilities: Serves as a liaison between the internal/external business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.Translates business requirements into functional specifications, manages changes to such specifications, and educates the IT organization on the direction of the business.Gathers information about the organization’s work processes and information flows.Documents existing process in technical model format in order to evaluate and define new IT solutions and implementation processes.Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business groups supported to enhance the enterprise’s competitive edge.Has basic knowledge in functions they support.Has knowledge and background of other technologies and tools.Has basic understanding of business, market and industry issues facing a specific business unit or function.Supports several simple to moderately complex business processes.Investigate and analyze feasibility of low to moderately complex enhancements, automations and processes.Analyze, define and interpret business needs and issues by gathering, analyzing, documenting and validating the Business area(s) and user(s) technical (functional/non-functional) requirements. Participates in the creation of complex PRD (Project Requirements Document) which includes defining Business, User, functional and non-functional requirements needed for approval by Business and for use by Design, Development and Testing teams. Participates in creation of Requirements Management Plan (RMP) for complex projects and may create RMP for less complex projects, to define, organize and schedule requirements management and development activities.Participates in requirements analysis and verification sessions for complex projects and may lead requirements analysis and verification sessions for less complex projects.Participates in the tracking and management of open issues and assists in planning for resolution for complex projects. Maintain communications with technical counterparts to adopt best practices and ensure integration of specific application architecture into overall enterprise technology strategy.Lead testing efforts by defining, developing and implementing practices and procedures for complete end user test plans.Ensures all user acceptance tests are conducted and documented according to standards. Identifies and documents system deficiencies and recommends solutions.Responsible for overall success of user acceptance testing, including results verification and release.Participates in the exploration of alternative business solutions for moderately complex processes, programs or applications, and may lead exploration of alternative business solutions for less complex processes, programs or applications to create, maintain and enhance business value. Works closely with system analysts to help create Proof Of Concepts (POCs) and alternative.Reviews, edits, analyze and create detailed documentation of business systems and user needs. Requirements: Translate stakeholders requirements into reporting deliverablesAssist analyst with dashboard and report generationDeliver ad hoc reportsProficient in ExcelRequires a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Business or relevant work experience in business analysis, systems analysis and/or testing background.3-6 years of direct Business Analyst experience.Demonstrated ability to elicit, document, analyze and verify requirementsExperience in or expose to business process analysis, Work flow, task analysis, user acceptance testing and requirements analysis.Must demonstrate understanding of industry standard Business Analysis Best Practices
