Name: SQL Data Analyst
Description: Description  Our client is seeking a dynamic, energetic and outgoing professional to fill the role of School Data Analyst in our Information Technology Department. The Analyst works closely with the Director of Business Intelligence and the Department of Schools on all school data and information initiatives. The position acts as the primary data analyst for student and school performance-related data, providing functional support to all student and school data end users.  Some of the essential functions of this job include:  Monitors information needs of the Department of Schools, including reports; makes technical recommendations to modify existing systems and reports as needed.  Extracts data from a student information system (SIS) and assists others in utilizing this system.  Develops queries and reports as needed.  Serves as primary liaison with standardized testing vendors and analyzes information related to standardized test scores, enrollment trends and other indicators of a schools academic viability.  Assists with improving the awareness of data with schools and archdiocesan departments.  Supports the processes for geocoding student data.  Works with SIS Manager to implement and support PowerSchool in production environment.  An ideal candidate will possess the following:  Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or Statistics  Three to five years experience in business analysisor equivalent combination of education and experience.  Experience with report writers such as SQL Server Reporting Services, IBM Cognos, Power BI.  SQL Server experience preferred.  Strong interpersonal communication, organizational and analytical skills.  Experience with SIS systems (PowerSchool), databases, and end user training is required.  Microsoft Word and Excel experience required; MS Access, Project, and Visio experience is a plus.  Experience with the spatial representation of data.  Ability to work independently and be self-motivated while also being detail-focused.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: McCormick & Company, Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor and seasonings industry, is seeking a full time Business Process Analyst in Materials Mangement Department. This new hire will work in Flavor Manufacturing Center, located in Hunt Valley, MD. The Business Process Analyst will report to a Materials Manager.  With more than $4 billion in annual sales, the Company manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food flavored by McCormick. McCormick makes every moment and meal better  As a company recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services. Benefits include, but are not limited to, tuition assistance, medical, dental, vision, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing, paid holidays and vacations. POSITION SUMMARY: Under the general direction of the Department Lead- Materials Management, the Business Process Analyst will be responsible for analytics, report generation, daily support of operational requirements, and administration in support of the Logistics mission and objectives. The scope of operations included inbound shipments from suppliers to our plants, stock transport orders, outbound customer shipments, and cross-border shipments. RESPONSIBILITES:Collect, compile and report on key performance indicators (KPI's) and ensure timely and accurate reporting of Logistics scorecardProvide operational support for outbound, inbound, and transfer shipments both for the US and CanadaDevelop, expand, and complete standard and ad hoc reporting requestsMonitor and maintain data within SAP, compile database deliverables, resolve system errors, and maintain data tables to comply with business rulesBuild and run queries for routine and specialized reports, fulfilling the role of expert resource for LogisticsPrepare detailed documentation and operating instructions of new and fully operational systems structures in accordance with continued process improvements initiativesWork cross functionally with operations and supporting teams to provide a resource for verifying key data and performance reportsProvide technical support and training as a resource for relevant system applications including maintenance and update of SAP idocsSupport and backup freight payment processesREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Transportation, Business, Information Technology, Accounting or related fieldMinimum 2 years of experience with database administrationExperience managing multiple projects / initiatives simultaneously and executing them successfully to completionProficiency with Microsoft Access, Excel, Word and PowerPointStrong experience with an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System (i.e. SAP, Oracle, etc)Ability to communicate effectively in a team-based environment with strong ability to influence and work on cross functional projects across all levels and functionsExcellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skillsProven attention to detail and accuracyAbility to maintain confidential and personal informationDemonstrated excellent problem solving, analytical and organizational skillsWillingness and ability to work flexible hourPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:SAP experienceExperience in Transportation Management Solutions (TMS)Project participation integrating SAP and external systemsExperience in a Supply Chain Planning environment with knowledge of inbound, transfer, outbound and cross border shipping. Particularly, experience with Canadian domestic shipping McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.  As a general policy, McCormick does not offer employment visa sponsorships upon hire or in the future.SDL2017

Name: PREP Grants & Contracts Analyst
Description: Classified Title: Grants & Contracts Analyst  Working Title: PREP Grants & Contracts Analyst  Role/Level/Range: ATP/03/PC  Starting Salary Range: $50,200 to $68,090 per year  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: M-F, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.  Exempt Status: Exempt  Location: 25-MD:JH at Columbia Center  Department name: 10001507-Energetics Research Group  Personnel area: Whiting School of Engineering General Summary: This position will be primarily responsible for the financial management of the JHU NIST PREP Program. Primary duties will include subaward coordination and processing between JHU and our partner universities. In addition, this position is tasked with financial management of the program budget and financial reporting to both internal and our sponsor resources. Also, this position works with the Corporate and Government Program Office in their mission to fully integrate non-traditional commercial and government research sponsorship into the WSE portfolio. The ideal candidate will serve as a material resource for faculty researchers in pre-award and proposal development budgeting exercises and lend expertise to support fiscal management and reporting. This is a salaried, exempt position.  The analyst will provide dedicated professional level sponsored funds management for more than 80% of time. The primary goal of this position has responsibility for post-award functions that include, but may not be limited to: budget development, account maintenance and oversight, billing/invoicing, reporting, compliance, and closeout. Other responsibilities include processing travel reimbursements, purchasing and invoicing responsibilities and human resource related tasks, e.g. stipend disbursement and visa processing for foreign applicants. The pre-award activity may include proposal preparation, submission, and budget development. One must be able to work independently on a variety of grants/contracts that range from simple to moderately complex. While this role may assist with some aspects of non-sponsored funds, the primary goal of this position is to ensure timely, effective and efficient functioning of sponsored funding. Job Scope/Complexity: The ideal candidate will work independently the majority of the time, with support from Principal Investigator (PI) and/or senior/management level grants & contract professionals on increasingly more complex grants/contracts. This individual will provide standard professional administrative level guidance on protocols, regulations and guidelines to PI and other scientific/research professionals within the department. One may interact with external research/administrative professionals.  Types of Sponsored Awards for which the Position is Responsible:  This role functions at an intermediate level, with responsibility for independent management of simple to moderately complex grants/contracts, including those from NIH, NSF, DOD and NASA. These grants, contracts and awards may involve detailed budgets, sub-awards and special instructions in RFA, career awards, training awards, multi-project grants, complex Foundation grants, sub-awards from other institutions on their federal pass-through grants. Primary Duties and Responsibilities:Understand and utilize institutional policies for post award grant process and sponsor guidelines.Review budgets and related justification for appropriateness and completeness of content. Ensures that all applicable and indirect costs have been applied. May also provide groundwork for subcontract negotiations.Ensure compliance in all other areas related to grant and contract management, including sponsoring organization guidelines, internal protocols, accurate protocol information within grant documents, conflicts of interest, etc.Maintain ongoing updates and communications related to current grants and contracts, this includes regular auditing and reporting to principal investigators and departmental leadership. Assist with closeouts as needed.Coordinate the process of setting up awards in designated department/division after grant number is assigned, including reviewing award, verifying award set-up and ensuring personnel is setup appropriately.Pro-actively ensures spending is compliant in accordance with institutional and sponsor regulations, terms, and conditions.Ensure that post-award responsibilities are completed, including budget distribution, account reconciliation, e-form setup, effort reporting, cost transfers, paying invoices and paperwork finalization related to subcontract setup.Conduct complex award management activities including monitoring and managing accounts, audits, evaluations and reporting.Provide information and direct assistance required to complete contract and grant closeouts.Partner with departmental faculty and/or budgetary staff and the Divisional Office of Research Administration toward the planning and development of application submissions to various federal offices, private agencies/foundations and commercial companies. May review sponsored project proposals for assigned faculty prior to them being forwarded to the Grants & Contracts Manager and Divisional Sponsored Projects Office for signature. Review involves accuracy, content, and adherence to all relevant guidelines.May be expected to provide instruction, preparation assistance and support related to grant application procedures.May serve as liaison between research units, central offices and funding agencies.Minimum Qualifications:Bachelors degree required.Two years of administrative/budgeting experience.Additional education may substitute for required experience and additional related experience may substitute for required education, to the extent permitted by the JHU equivalency formula. JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job. Additional Applicable Information: Successful completion of the RAT program (18-24 months) is equivalent to three years of relevant experience for this position. If an employee does not successfully complete the program, no additional experience will be applied. Special Skills/Knowledge:Knowledge of accounting and budgeting theory and practices required. Thorough knowledge and understanding of The Johns Hopkins University accounting system and related fiscal offices preferred.Ability to make independent judgments and to act on decisions on a daily basis.Ability to work with flexibility on several tasks simultaneously and to meet various concurrent deadlines.Knowledge of external Federal guidelines/procedures for grants and contracts, including NIH, NSF, DOD and NASA. The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711.  The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly.  During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Note: Job Postings are updated daily and remain online until filled.  EEO is the Law Learn more: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf  Important legal information  http://hrnt.jhu.edu/legal.cfm  JH at Columbia CenterSDL2017

Name: Patient Experience Data Analyst - Service Excellence
Description: Position Summary Under the direction of the Patient Experience Lead Data Manager, the Patient Experience Data Analyst supports all aspects of the patient satisfaction measurement process, ensures data integrity and meaningful reporting and interpretation of data. An expert in measurement, this position works in partnership with the lead analyst, patient experience coaches, and Chief Patient Experience Officer to ensure the organization meets or exceeds the service goals as measured by the JHHS voluntary survey as well as the federal and state required satisfaction surveys. (Press Ganey, CAHPS) The Patient Experience Data Analyst is responsible for providing in-depth, proactive consultation and direction to managers and staff based on meaningful data dissecting and visualizations. Supports the lead analyst and service excellence teams with accurate data, dashboards, special drilldown reports and Board level reports. Prepares regular and special reports regarding hospital service performance for leadership meetings at all levels including the Board of Trustees.  Competencies: Education: Masters degree in statistics, public health, health administration, business or a related field is preferred, Bachelors degree required. May substitute years of experience in the health data experience for years of education. Knowledge: Statistical analysis, survey methodology and design, process improvement, and health care related customer service methods. Skills: Data analysis and interpretation related to patient satisfaction surveys. Experience in the use of standard word processing, power point, statistical analysis, and spreadsheet software. Strong project management, public speaking, problem identification and resolution skills. Excellent interpersonal and communications skills required to work with a diverse group of people. Experience with data visualization software is a plus, such as Tableau or Business Objects. Work Experience: Minimum 3-5 years in health care data or data analysis and reporting.  Machines, Tools, Equipment: General office and communication equipment (i.e., personal computers, electronic mail, telephone systems, fax, copiers, etc.) Required Licensure, Certification:  None  Day Shift Full Time 40 hours 8:00 am 4:30 pm  Exempt, Pay Grade: NK  Working Conditions:  Works in a normal office environment where there are limited physical discomforts due to temperature, noise, dust.  Requires attention to detail for data analysis and preparation of reports, presentations, etc.  Johns Hopkins is a Smoke Free campus.

Name: Regional Credit Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionFishman Flooring Solutions, an industry leader, is searching for the next great addition to our credit team at our corporate headquarters in Baltimore, MD. This Regional Credit Analyst position is a fantastic opportunity to make an impact with a growing, stable, 100% employee owned company. This position places a high emphasis on attention to detail and credit tasks.  Fishman Flooring Solutions offers employment with a family oriented organization that is nearing one hundred (100) years in business and a competitive benefits package. Just some of the benefits include: health/dental/vision insurance; paid vacation, holidays, sick days; profit sharing bonus plan; retirement/401k; and employee stock ownership plan.  The ideal candidate will possess:  · A minimum of two (2) years of experience as a trade credit analyst  · Experience in construction or building products industry (preferred)  · Ability to support Regional Credit Managers in their day to day roles and in their absence  · Knowledge of general accounting practices and account reconciliation  · Experience with general collection duties including contact through calls and emails  · Knowledge of credit duties such as application processing and credit hold releases  · Ability to perform account maintenance and deduction resolution  · Knowledge of mechanic lien process, lien waiver execution and completion  · Knowledge of statutory construction notices is a plus  · Ability to assist in marketing of e-commerce program  · Ability to develop and update reports and spreadsheets  · Ability to complete special projects and miscellaneous assignments as required  · Proficiency with MS Office and Google equivalents  · Familiarity with Eclipse ERP software is a plus  · Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, high attention to detail and accuracy  · Outstanding communication skills and professional telephone demeanor  · Associate’s or bachelor’s degree (preferred)

Name: Data Analyst
Description: EducationBachelor's DegreeSkillsSQLTableauRData WarehousePython Do you geek out at the intersection of statistics and storytelling? Are you passionate about finding the story the data is telling, and using it to help drive key decisions? Are you interested in helping shape the direction of the world's best fitness brand?  Let's talk.  The Under Armour team not only makes the best performance apparel and shoes on the planet, we also offer the world's most integrated digital health suite of apps, devices, and apparel. And we need a cutting-edge digital marketing analyst to help bring that story together. You / Data Analyst will partner with our marketing team derive insights from our digital health platforms that inform the clients' understanding of the digital health consumer and their own relationship with that consumer. The candidate will be part of the analytics team who supports tasks that include: In depth analysis of marketing and consumer data, includingUser behavior analysisSegmentation studiesDriver analysesAdvanced exploratory analytics to drive insightful and reportingPerformance metrics definition, algorithm development and automationReporting and visualizationIntegration with Engineering teamsRequirements building for feature development for use in analyticsInstrumentation optimization with development engineersComplex data analysis tasksData anomaly detection and correction modelingTransformation and manipulation scriptingConversion of data into stories for internal and external consumptionCross-team support for multiple application platforms and verticalsThe candidate must have experience with:Advanced degree in an analytical field (math, business, statistics, hard or social sciences) and 1-2+ years in data analytics, or BA in like field with 2-3+ years experienceUsing data to solve complex business questionsCommunicating data stories in written and verbal form to wide audiences of varying levels of sophisticationAdvanced SQL skillsJavaScript D3 libraries or Tableau visualizationProgramming in a scripting environment (e.g. Python) or ETL development experienceDexterity with an advanced statistical package (e.g. R, SciPy)**We are unable to hire student visas at this time.

Name: Business Analyst III
Description: Tracking Code IEWSD-18-1803-F Job Code 18-1803 Posting Title Business Analyst III Post Date 10/30/2018 Full Time / Part-Time Full Time Travel Up to 25% City Aberdeen Proving Ground State MD Country US Description Business Analyst III (IEWSD-18-1803-F)  Bowhead seeks a Business Analyst III to support the IEWS-D at Aberdeen Proving Ground in Aberdeen, MD. The Business Analyst III will conduct requirements analysis and definition, testing, business consulting and support services for automated acquisition systems.  As well as conduct organizational studies and evaluations, design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification and measurement studies, and prepare operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Requirements • Bachelor's Degree Business or Accounting 7 years relevant experience within the last 10 years. SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIRED: Must currently hold a security clearance at the Secret level. US Citizenship is a requirement for Secret clearance at this location.  Applicants may be subject to a pre-employment drug & alcohol screening and/or random drug screen, and must follow UIC’s Non-DOT Drug & Alcohol Testing Program requirements. If the position requires, an applicant must pass a pre-employment criminal background  history check. All post-secondary education listed on the applicant’s resume/application may be subject to verification.  Where driving may be required or where a rental car must be obtained for business travel purposes, applicants must have a valid driver license for this position and will be subject to verification. In addition, the applicant must pass an in-house, online, driving  course to be authorized to drive for company purposes.  UIC is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics EOE/AA/M/F/D/V. In furtherance, pursuant to The Alaska  Native Claims Settlement Act 43 U.S.C. Sec. 1601 et seq., and federal contractual requirements, UIC and its subsidiaries may legally grant certain preference in employment opportunities to UIC Shareholders and their Descendants, based on the provisions contained  within The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act.  All candidates must apply online at www.uicalaska.com, and submit a completed application for all positions they wish to be considered. Once the employment application has been completed and submitted, any changes to the application after submission may not  be reviewed. Please contact a UIC HR Recruiter if you have made a significant change to your application. In accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (ADA), persons unable to complete an online application should contact UIC Human Resources  for assistance (http://www.uicalaska.com/contact-us/human-resources/).  UIC Government Services (UICGS / Bowhead) provides innovative business solutions to federal and commercial customers in the areas of engineering, maintenance services, information technology, program support, logistics/base support, and procurement. Collectively,  the fast-growing Bowhead Family of Companies offers a breadth of services which are performed with a focus on quality results. Headquartered in Alexandria, VA, we are a fast-growing, multi-million-dollar corporation recognized as one of the top 25 8(a) companies  for government contracting.  ^ Cut/Paste this Link to Apply: https://rn21.ultipro.com/UKP1001/jobboard/NewCandidateExt.aspx?__JobID=21446Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP  here.The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access  to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure  is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41  CFR 60-1.35(c)

Name: Global Operations Analyst/Associate
Description: Morgan Stanley is a leading Global Financial Services firm with a Global work force of 60,000 employees serving clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.  The Morgan Stanley Baltimore office is a critical component of the Firm`s Global footprint and has 1,400 employees that provide support and services to the Investment Banking, Securities, Investment Management and Wealth Management Businesses.  Our office at Thames Street Wharf is located in the new, up and coming neighborhood of Harbor Point, adjacent to historic Fells Point. Additionally, the Firm recently expanded downtown and occupies two floors at 100 South Charles in the heart of Baltimore's Inner Harbor.  In September 2017, the Baltimore Office received a Downtown Baltimore Award from the Downtown Partnership of Baltimore in recognition of the Firm’s continued expansion and civic commitment. We were also nominated for a Corporate Culture award from SmartCEO in October, which is a program that honors companies that foster a creative and collaborative workplace culture. Description of Role The Operations Division and Operational Risk Department are currently seeking high performing individuals with 3-6 years of work experience who exhibit strong leadership potential, communication skills, attention to detail and a strong desire to succeed in a fast paced and challenging work environment. The Operational Risk Department is also seeking high performing individuals to work with the business units and control groups ensuring Morgan Stanley has a transparent, consistent and comprehensive program for managing operational risk, both within each area and across the Firm globally; and effectively identify and mitigate Operational Risk while ensuring continued compliance with global regulatory requirements.  The Operations Division partners with Sales & Trading, Finance, Legal, and Technology to execute the Firm's Institutional, Retail, and Asset Management businesses by developing strong client relationships, collaborating closely with its business partners supporting and settling transactions, devising and implementing effective controls, to enable to development of new structures, businesses, and markets.  The Operational Risk Department looks at the risk of financial loss or other potential damages to the Firm's reputation due to inadequate or failed internal processes, people or systems, or from external events. While primary responsibility for managing operational risk lies within the business divisions and control groups, the Operational Risk Department designs, implements and monitors the company-wide operational risk program and operates as part of the Second Line of Defense, providing independent governance and oversight of operation risk management across the Firm.  Successful candidates will have an interest or familiarity in one or more of the following: Trade Support, Trade Processing, Settlements, AML/KYC, Fraud Operations, Strategic Business Analysis, Data Science/Analytics, Process Validation, Cybersecurity, Fraud, Third-Party, and Technology risk Cash Management, Loan Servicing, Reconciliations, Regulatory Reporting, Risk Management, Financing and Collateral, Budgeting and Business Management, Projects, Wealth Management and Client Services.  We are looking for resourceful and dedicated candidates with 3-6 years of work experience who possess the following attributes: Required ü  Demonstrated track record of achievement with the ability to take initiative in a challenging environment  ü  Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly communicate, as well as gather, information from a range of audiences  ü  Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills  ü  Self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership and accountability for tasks  ü  Adaptable team player  ü  Detail oriented and ability to adhere to strict timelines  ü  Strong organizational and time management skills  ü  Ability to multi-task and work in a fast pace environment  ü  Analytical skills  ü  Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, as well as review the completeness and execution of relevant procedures and assurance mechanisms  ü  Ability to proactively contribute towards continued improvements in control, processes, operational efficiency, and industry initiatives  ü  Experience working with large data sets including deconstructing data sets and/or their associated queries  ü  Strong Microsoft Office skills and advanced Excel knowledge Optional ü  Familiarity with the financial markets and current regulatory landscape  ü  Project management experience  We are focused on bringing together different backgrounds, experience and talents to deliver world class service. If you are a driven self-starter, client-focused, and eager to contribute to a leading Global Financial Services firm, please apply. We welcome all backgrounds and experiences, and no direct industry experience is required.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: McCormick & Company, Inc., a world leader in the spice, flavor and seasonings industry, is seeking a full time Business Process Analyst in Materials Mangement Department. This new hire will work in Flavor Manufacturing Center, located in Hunt Valley, MD. The Business Process Analyst will report to a Materials Manager.  With more than $4 billion in annual sales, the Company manufactures markets and distributes spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavorful products to the entire food industry retail outlets, food manufacturers and foodservice businesses. We create differentiating flavors consumers prefer with unmatched quality, science, innovation and service. Every day, no matter where or what you eat, you can enjoy food flavored by McCormick. McCormick makes every moment and meal better  As a company recognized for exceptional commitment to employees, McCormick offers a wide variety of benefits, programs and services. Benefits include, but are not limited to, tuition assistance, medical, dental, vision, disability, group life insurance, 401(k), profit sharing, paid holidays and vacations. POSITION SUMMARY: Under the general direction of the Department Lead- Materials Management, the Business Process Analyst will be responsible for analytics, report generation, daily support of operational requirements, and administration in support of the Logistics mission and objectives. The scope of operations included inbound shipments from suppliers to our plants, stock transport orders, outbound customer shipments, and cross-border shipments. RESPONSIBILITES:Collect, compile and report on key performance indicators (KPI's) and ensure timely and accurate reporting of Logistics scorecardProvide operational support for outbound, inbound, and transfer shipments both for the US and CanadaDevelop, expand, and complete standard and ad hoc reporting requestsMonitor and maintain data within SAP, compile database deliverables, resolve system errors, and maintain data tables to comply with business rulesBuild and run queries for routine and specialized reports, fulfilling the role of expert resource for LogisticsPrepare detailed documentation and operating instructions of new and fully operational systems structures in accordance with continued process improvements initiativesWork cross functionally with operations and supporting teams to provide a resource for verifying key data and performance reportsProvide technical support and training as a resource for relevant system applications including maintenance and update of SAP idocsSupport and backup freight payment processesREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Transportation, Business, Information Technology, Accounting or related fieldMinimum 2 years of experience with database administrationExperience managing multiple projects / initiatives simultaneously and executing them successfully to completionProficiency with Microsoft Access, Excel, Word and PowerPointStrong experience with an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System (i.e. SAP, Oracle, etc)Ability to communicate effectively in a team-based environment with strong ability to influence and work on cross functional projects across all levels and functionsExcellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skillsProven attention to detail and accuracyAbility to maintain confidential and personal informationDemonstrated excellent problem solving, analytical and organizational skillsWillingness and ability to work flexible hourPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:SAP experienceExperience in Transportation Management Solutions (TMS)Project participation integrating SAP and external systemsExperience in a Supply Chain Planning environment with knowledge of inbound, transfer, outbound and cross border shipping. Particularly, experience with Canadian domestic shipping McCormick & Company is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.  As a general policy, McCormick does not offer employment visa sponsorships upon hire or in the future.SDL2017

Name: Technical Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionTechnical Analyst Formed in 1924, Cowan Systems enjoys a history of excellence and quality in the transportation business. Due to continued growth, Cowan Systems, LLC has a Technical Analyst position available in our corporate office located in Halethorpe, Maryland.  The Technical Analyst will provide exceptional customer service and act as an initial point of contact for end-users in the corporate headquarters and remote locations. The Technical Analyst assists staff with technical support of desktop computers, applications, telecommunications and related technology across our 24x7 enterprise. Support includes interaction with application software and operating systems to diagnose and resolve unique, recurring and non-recurring problems and documenting issues in the help desk ticketing system. Responsibilities require independent analyses, communication and problem solving skills. This position reports to the Help Desk Supervisor. Responsibilities include: - Support and maintenance of the desktops, laptops, IP phones, mobile phones, printers and peripherals on the corporate network.  - Support of the company's enterprise virtual desktop and application delivery software systems in conjunction with other members of the IT staff.  - Accurately log all support requests in the Track-It help desk system. Acknowledge, troubleshoot and resolve all assigned tickets; escalate and follow through when necessary especially in system down situations.  - Responsible for creation, deletion and modification of user accounts and MS Exchange mailboxes.  - Responsible to communicate all system related issues to IT staff through channels set forth by management.  - Facilitates moves, additions, and changes of computer and phone related equipment as required.  - Perform user profile data migrations and restorations.  - Maintenance of hardware and software inventory within the Track-It system.  - Assist next level IT support staff as necessary.  - Participate in the on-call rotation.  - Other tasks as assigned. Qualifications - BA/BS degree in a computing discipline and 1 year of work experience or 2-3 years providing PC desktop support in a corporate WAN environment.  - Previous experience supporting Microsoft Windows 7 in a corporate environment required.  - Experience supporting Microsoft Office with comprehensive knowledge of Outlook required.  - Experience with desktop imaging software.  - Familiarity with VoIP, general telecom and associated technologies a plus.  - Experienced supporting enterprise-level multifunction printer/copiers/scanners also helpful. Additional: - Strong customer-service orientation. Effective interpersonal and relationship-building skills. Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language to both technical and non-technical end-users.  - Ability to multi-task and remain calm and composed under pressure.  - Ability to lift and carry related computer & networking equipment.  - Ability to climb ladders and stairs.  - Must possess a valid driver's license and a vehicle for local travel to remote sites. Part of the Technical Analysts responsibility will be to support (in a rotation) an annex of the corporate office located about a mile away.  - Ability to travel (infrequent - less than 5%) to locations across the US for short durations.  #cs

Job Req ID:  13439 Reserach Data AnalystClassified Title: [[Research Data Analyst]]  Working Title: [[Research Data Analyst]] ​​​​​  Role/Level/Range: ACRP/04/MC  Starting Salary Range: [[$44,749 - $73,945]]  Employee group: Full Time  Schedule: [[Monday - Friday , 8:30a - 5:00p / 37.5 hrs per wk]]  Exempt Status: Exempt ​​​​​​​  Location: 06-MD:School of Nursing  Department name: 10003814-Community Public Health Nursing  Personnel area: School of Nursing General Summary/Purpose A Research Data Analyst position is open in the Center for Innovative Care in Aging at the Johns Hopkins School of Nursing. The successful applicant will work with an interdisciplinary team of faculty. Under the supervision of faculty investigators, the data analyst will collaborate on innovative Center and grant-funded research projects that focus on health and well-being of older adults, their families, and/or communities. Specific Duties & Responsibilities Conduct statistical analyses for clinical trials and large epidemiological and longitudinal studies using standard statistical software packages (e.g., SAS, STATA). Design and prepare tables and figures to illustrate analytic findings.Collaborate with statisticians, epidemiologists, social scientists, and clinicians in drafting of statistical design, methods, and analysis sections for reports, scientific papers, and grant proposalsMinimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in related discipline. 3 years related experience.  Additional education (Master's level) may substitute for required experience, to the extent permitted by the  JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job.Preferred QualificationsBachelor’s degree in public health, computer science, epidemiology, statistics, demography or a related scientific field is required.Master’s degree preferred.Strong quantitative skills, experience with data management, and applied data analysis, including mediation and moderation analyses is required.Must be detail-oriented and able to work independently. The successful candidate(s) for this position will be subject to a pre-employment background check.  If you are interested in applying for employment with The Johns Hopkins University and require special assistance or accommodation during any part of the pre-employment process, please contact the HR Business Services Office at jhurecruitment@jhu.edu. For TTY users, call via Maryland Relay or dial 711. The following additional provisions may apply depending on which campus you will work. Your recruiter will advise accordingly. During the Influenza ("the flu") season, as a condition of employment, The Johns Hopkins Institutions require all employees who provide ongoing services to patients or work in patient care or clinical care areas to have an annual influenza vaccination or possess an approved medical or religious exception. Failure to meet this requirement may result in termination of employment.  The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Blood tests for immunities to these diseases are ordinarily included in the pre-employment physical exam except for those employees who provide results of blood tests or immunization documentation from their own health care providers. Any vaccinations required for these diseases will be given at no cost in our Occupational Health office. Name: Systems Analyst
Description: *Responsibilities:** ActioNet supports the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services in key areas of health IT solutions delivery. We are looking for Health Plan Management System (HPMS) experienced Systems Analysts with experience at CMS, Health IT, or similar systems development environments. Our team members work with their federal counterparts and business owners to help CMS reach its mission goals. Scope of position requirements: ? Demonstrated capacity to define system scope and objectives, formulate technical solutions including integration and consolidation across multiple applications and platforms, for very large systems environments.  ? Formulates/defines specifications for operating software programming applications or modifies/maintains complex existing applications using engineering releases and utilities from the manufacturer.  ? Ability to think critically and understand the larger business process and business need driving a given IT problem. Strong demonstrated problem solving capabilities.  ? Must possess sharp attention to detail, have proven organizational skills (time management and prioritization), and also employ a rigorous process for all follow-up / coordination activities.  ? Prepares detailed specifications for programs. Assists in the design, development, testing, implementation, and documentation of new software and enhancements of existing applications.  ? Analyze and model system functions, using activity and sequence diagrams, and UML modeling.  ? Interface at 25% and 75% intervals with Business Requirements Analysts to check for completeness and to suggest areas of focus. Offer draft System Design outlines at 75% complete Business Requirements to check for alignment with existing environment or to identifies gaps for new functionality. Prepare System Design documents from 90-100% complete Business Requirements.  ? Positive and enthusiastic attitude; strong dedication to customer service. *Skills Required:** ? Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Software Engineering Business.  ? Hands-on experience with - C#.Net. *Skills Preferred:** ? Health Plan Management System experience working in support of the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services delivery of Medicare Advantage and Medicare Part D programs  ? 5+ years of directly related experience with SDLC processes for large, multi-application systems environments, and 5+ years of system design experience.  ? 5+ years hand-on experience with at least one of the following programming languages - Java, C#.Net, and PHP. 5+ years hand-on experience with RDBMS design and SQL programming.  ? Experience in healthcare industry.  ? ITIL certification or Six Sigma Certification a plus.  ActioNet is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer  All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, protected veteran status, race, color, religious creed, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation/gender identity, age (40 or over), or genetic information. ActioNet?s commitment to diversity and inclusive selection practices includes ensuring qualified long-term unemployed job seekers receive equal consideration for employment.  The ActioNet Career Center is accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of this portal or you need assistance completing the application process, please contact Jonathan Dobles, Technical Recruiter, at 703-204-0090 ext 195 or JDobles@ActioNet.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Name: Mobile Business Analyst, Junior
Description: Job Number: R0036609 Mobile Business Analyst, JuniorKey Role:  Provide IT program and project support, process analysis, asset management, and logistics for the DoD Mobility Secure Mobility Implementation Team (SMIT). Engage with senior stakeholders regularly to ensure secure mobile device order requests are fulfilled. Work collaboratively in a high-paced, dynamic environment to support business related requests for high-profile DoD mission partners. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Tracking Code  CMA 2653-585  Job DescriptionCALIBRE is seeking a Financial Analyst to provide assistance within the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Operations Center performing financial functions involving the formulation, justification, and execution of internal program budgets; development of detailed programming and financial planning justification and documentation; and analysis of trends and developments in DISA’s planning, programming, budget and execution (PPBE) process concerning appropriations, funding priorities, and workload management.  This support includes, but is not limited to: Assist in the development of detailed programming and financial planning justifications and documentation for inclusion in the Program Objectives Memorandum (POM) and Five-Year Defense Program (FYDP) submissions.Analyze trends and developments in DISA’s PPBE process concerning appropriations, funding priorities, and workload management, which support overall program operations.Organize budget data according to appropriation account, program, object classification code, and line item code.Review estimates to assure that amounts requested are within established guidelines and meet requirements.Research, compile, verify, and summarize data involving operating expenses, as related to object classification code and line item information.Enter budgetary information in automated financial systems, develop reports and schedules using Microsoft applications, DoD and DISA automated systems.Attend budget briefings and conferences and assist in answering questions to justify and defend budget estimates, program and resource requirements, and appropriation requests.Required SkillsActive Secret security clearance requiredProficient skills in Microsoft Office applicationsRequired ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Finance or related fieldDesired QualificationsCertified Defense Financial Manager (CDFM) credentialMinimum 4 years DOD budget experience. Related experience in other organizations will be considered.Familiarity with DOD policies, regulations, and procedures, particularly related to working capital funds.Working knowledge of DOD PPBE processes. CALIBRE is an Equal Opportunity Employer and supports transitioning service members, veterans and individuals with disabilities. We offer a competitive salary and full benefits package. To be considered, please apply via our website at www.calibresys.com. Come join our dynamic team!Job Location  Ft. Meade, Maryland, United States  Position Type  Full-Time/Regular

Name: Programmer Analyst
Description: CallisonRTKL seeks an experienced Programmer Analyst to join our Management Information Systems team. The Programmer Analyst will be responsible for daily support of CallisonRTKLs critical business applications. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong leadership skills and can partner with others in a collaborative, cross functional team environment.  Responsibilities  Provides technical direction and team development working closely with firm leadership Enhances our administrative and project management systems, proposing improvements to business processes, system performance and data integrity Makes critical decisions in the areas of analysis and problem solving Delivers hands-on application support for mission critical firmwide applications systems Works closely with other teams in the implementation of process improvements Creates/updates documentation, policies, procedures, workflows, and user guides Provides user application and process training and support Provides support for system upgrades and rollouts on nights and weekends Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related field Strong management, organizational and project management skills Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, supervisors and external parties (vendor representatives) Excellent oral and written communication skills Experience in SQL development / programming Microsoft SQL Server including security management, SSRS, SSAS, database design and integration Demonstrated programming language knowledge to include .Net Framework (including VB.NET, C#, ASP.NET), C/C++, SQL, PL/SQL, XML, HTML, IIS Experience in Batch Scheduling Tools / Job Automation Ability to work quickly and independently in a fast-paced environment Stays up-to-date with latest technology and shares best practices across a large portfolio of applications and platforms Experience with Deltek Vision or similar project accounting and management software preferred Consulting background with customer service approach to systems management preferred

Name: Business Systems Analyst II
Description: Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.About the teamOur North American Lending team division works with all aspects of loan origination platforms projects. On this team, we develop and provide open-architecture software products and services that manage volume intensive credit operations over wide-area networks. Furthermore, our products and services provide innovative solutions that credit-enable business-to-business and business-to-consumer transactions. What you will be doingAs our business systems analyst, you will elicit, analyze, communicate and validate business/user requirements for processes, policies and information systems. You will be translating these business needs/end-user requirements into functional specifications that describe what the system, process or product/service must do to fulfill the end-user/business requirements. On this role, you will be working out of our credit automation software and services department.You will formulate and define system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements.You will be required to identify improvement opportunities, analyze business and user needs. Furthermore, you will need to document business processes and metrics as well as how applications and systems interact to support business processes.You will Influence our business partners and service providers regarding priorities, hardware/software selection and/or vendor selection.You will write test plans and test cases to ensure changes which are made to the application meet our client needs and that application integrity is maintained.You will conduct a variety of tests such as system, integration, readiness, and acceptance tests. You will need to ensure that the changes made by programmers are correct. You will conduct tests using client data to be certain that client needs are met. You will verify through testing that changes made by programmers to one part of the application do not impact other parts. You will report and review the testing results to your teamWhat you bring:A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related discipline is required; or equivalent combination of education and experience that is required for the specific job level.Knowledge of financial services industry, preferably lending experience.Four or more years of business systems analysis experienceYou will need to have experience working on small to large, complex projects that require increased skill in business modeling and requirement definition.Proficiency in solutions design and requirements definition disciplines leveraging model driven design-based tools and techniques including conceptual solution component models, business process models, use cases, etc.Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors)What we offer youA multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities.A variety of career development tools, resources and opportunities.The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology.Varied and challenging work to help you grow your technical skillset.A fantastic range of benefits including medical cover, dental cover, vision cover, company paid vacation, 401k match and employee stock purchasing match.A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!

Name: HRIS Implementation Analyst
Description: About CRS: Catholic Relief Services carries out the commitment of the Bishops of the United States to assist the poor and vulnerable overseas. Our Catholic identity is at the heart of our mission and operations. We welcome as a part of our staff and as partners people of all faiths and secular traditions who share our values and our commitment to serving those in need.  CRS is implementing a new ERP (Oracle) in the US and across all of our nearly 70 global locations. We are seeking a skilled technical project manager to help us roll out, manage, and support the HR component (Oracle HCM) of this implementation.  At the direction of the Global HRIS Manager, and in collaboration with the Project Office of CRS' new Oracle ERP, the HRIS Implementation Analyst is responsible for the configuration and testing of the assigned HR-related modules of CRS' new ERP.About CRS Catholic Relief Services is the official international humanitarian agency of the Catholic community in the United States. CRS works to save, protect, and transform lives in need in more than 100 countries, without regard to race, religion or nationality. CRS' relief and development work is accomplished through programs of emergency response, HIV, health, agriculture, education, microfinance and peacebuilding. Job Summary CRS is implementing a new ERP (Oracle) in the US and across all of our nearly 70 global locations. We are seeking a skilled technical project manager to help us roll out, manage, and support the HR component (Oracle HCM) of this implementation.  At the direction of the Global HRIS Manager, and in collaboration with the Project Office of CRS' new Oracle ERP, the HRIS Implementation Analyst is responsible for the configuration and testing of the assigned HR-related modules of CRS' new ERP. Job Responsibilities:Roll Out Serve as the primary HRIS Implementation Analyst for all aspects of the assigned HR module(s) of Oracle HCM, including: Identifying ongoing enhancements to the base implementation of Oracle HCM and the delivery of functional specifications and business processesIdentifying requirements, meeting key customer objectives and success measurements, while taking into consideration the overall operating modelIdentifying testing plan related to the roll-out of the new enhancement of HR functionality that is already in place including test scripts and test plans to ensure configuration and data flow are in line with functional specificationsWorking with CRS' external implementation partners to perform specific configuration- and testing-related tasks within the project plan, and to ensure quality, timely delivery against project plan milestonesEnsuring relevant configurations of Oracle "fast formulas" (which automate calculations of leave, benefits, etc. based on a fixed set of variables), system reports, and HR security permissionsDeveloping and documenting appropriate work-arounds or non-system related functions not covered by the systemPreparing and collecting data conversion collection templates required for populating the assigned HR module(s) required for go-liveParticipating in four testing cycles by performing configurations, executing conversions, conducting and leading testers through the testing plan and conducting break/fixSupporting and guiding users of the application and the testing of new functionalityDeployment Ensure a successful "go-live" process, including: Troubleshooting and resolving systems and/or configuration issuesPost-Deployment Ensure successful operations and continual evolution of functionality, as needed, including: Assisting with Fit/Gap analysis and identifying required RICEF (Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, Enhancements and Forms)Writing functional specifications for technical documentation and build of RICEF objectsProviding timely and quality support to end users related to configurationManaging configuration and testing associated with new modules and functionalityDocumenting a deep internal expertise in the software solution chosen by and configured for CRSPerforming other duties and special projects as assignedBasic QualificationsBachelor's Degree, preferably in Human Resources, Business Administration, Finance, Public administration, Marketing, or another related field5 years relevant work experienceKnowledge Skills and AbilitiesStrong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skillsStrong attention to detailStrong verbal and written communication skillsHighly organized with proven ability to prioritizeAbility to think of the "big picture"Preferred QualificationsExperience in HR operations preferredHandling confidential and sensitive informationMulti-tasking in a fast-paced environmentAgency-wide Competencies (for all CRS Staff) These are rooted in the mission, values, and guiding principles of CRS and used by each staff member to fulfill his or her responsibilities and achieve the desired results. Name: Program Management Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionBackground Candidate will develop acquisition logistics processes to turn shipbuilder CDRLs into usable logistics support artifacts for Supply Support, Maintenance Planning, Technical Information, and Design Interface. Develop product support management procedures and overarching quality management procedures to ensure the processes work effectively. Implement quality monitoring or assurance mechanisms to evaluate performance and monitor & control project performance for the HPIB logistics development. Job Duties Duties will include:  · Monitor & control project performance for the Heavy Polar Ice Breaker (HPIB) logistics development.  · Assist the Asset Project Office Major Cutters Division with implementing project control and communications procedures for HPIB Integrated Logistics Support development.  · For all elements of logistics ensure project progress is monitored, documented, and communicated.  · Document risks based on evaluations of progress and identify changes necessary to accomplish project objectives.  · Develop an efficient framework for quality management  · Develop efficient & complain processes for each of the specified areas  · Monitor & control quality, subject to government supervision Minimum Position Requirements · BA/BS Degree  · 3-10 Years of relevant experience  · Expertise in project management  · Effective communications and briefing skills to senior PMs and PEO  · Ability to proactively identify & mitigate risks  · The ability to research, find, and synthesize information  · Expertise or proven methodology in designing efficient processes  · Expertise in ILS, Logistics Supportability Analysis or Product Support Management  · Excellent Communication Skills, written & verbal Security Clearance Requirement Secret Obtainable Place of Performance Baltimore, MD To Apply For This Position Use the following link to apply: (Insert link here) Company Highlights At LHG, we offer our employees a full comprehensive and competitive benefits package. Our benefits package features:  · Competitive salaries  · Paid time off  · Health, dental and vision insurance  · Company paid short/long term disability  · Company paid Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment insurance  · 401(k) (up to 3% matching)  · FSA  · Other company perks  The Loch Harbour Group is an equal opportunity employer, all interested qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, D/M/V/F. LHG welcomes and encourages diversity in the workforce.Company DescriptionThe Loch Harbour Group (LHG) is a Certified Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business. For nearly two decades, we have provided versatile, multifaceted professional services to government and private sector clients. LHG draws on many decades of accumulated experience within its organization and key contacts across the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, Veterans Affairs as well as the private sector.  LHG's focus on delivering customer satisfaction is built upon our team of principled leaders, analysts and technicians that are experts in their respective technical fields. We build teams of these experts to deliver cost effective technical solutions to:  Effectively manage complex information technology development programs/projects  Deliver effective and efficient information technology services  Provide full spectrum acquisition management support  Provide executive level decision support at the strategic, operational and tactical levels  Company Highlights: At LHG, we offer our employees a full comprehensive and competitive benefits package. Our benefits package features:  Competitive salaries  Paid time off  Health, dental and vision insurance  Company paid short/long term disability  Company paid Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment insurance  401(k) (up to 3% matching) FSA Other company perks  The Loch Harbour Group is an equal opportunity employer, all interested qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, D/M/V/F. Location: 05-MD:School of Public Health  Department name: 10001135-International Health Sponsored Projects  Personnel area: School of Public Health *General Summary/Purpose** As a central resource, administer and coordinate financial operations across multiple overseas projects within the Department of International Health insuring accuracy and compliance with department/university policies. overseas offices and foreign organizations.  + Oversee and review Imprest fund activity within the Department of International Health.  + Maintenance of a department-wide tracking system for foreign administrator *Minimum Qualifications** Bachelor?s degree in finance, accounting, or other related field. 5 years progressively responsible related financial/accounting experience. *Preferred The pre-employment physical for positions in clinical areas, laboratories, working with research subjects, or involving community contact requires documentation of immune status against Rubella (German measles), Rubeola (Measles), Mumps, Varicella (chickenpox), Hepatitis B and documentation of having received the Tdap (Tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis) vaccination. This may include documentation of having two (2) MMR vaccines; two (2) Varicella vaccines; or antibody status to these diseases from laboratory testing. Name: Telecom Provisioning Analyst
Description: Accountable for working on a customer engagement utilizing the TurningPoint telecom lifecycle and expense management solution (TEMS).  Our telecom solution is essential to our agency customers in the performance of their assigned mission. Key to success in this role is the ability to interact with clients and work with internal staff such that all service and deliverables provided are of high quality and exceed customer expectations.  As a Telecom Data and Provisioning Analyst, you will focus on helping our federal government customers with telecom data collection, order processing, inventory management, invoice upload and reconciliation, billing audits and disputes, technology upgrades, and contract transitions. The job will involve review and analysis of telecom inventory, bills, service order information, inventory audits, and interaction with telecom carriers. It will also require development of reports associated with pricing, cost management, inventory, project status, and intra-agency billing.  Responsibilities may also include working with stakeholders in process definition and improvement, and understanding and documenting business system requirements for telecom ordering approval workflows, security roles, users, reporting, etc.  Customer engagements cover all aspects of telecom, including wireline, wireless, satellite, equipment, licenses, security, and professional services. Proficiency in one or more of these areas, and experience in the federal telecom and contracting environment is important to being successful in this role and being able to provide value quickly. Functional Responsibility: Preparation of service orders for review and handoff with government authorized staff  Participates in daily/weekly upload, validation, and reconciliation of inventory, and electronic invoices  Responsibility for assisting with optimization and cost reduction recommendations and documentation  Tracking of order and dispute progress, and escalation as needed  Addresses Tier 1 Support questions; refers technical issues and new requirements to TurningPoint Tier 2 for resolution and tracks them to resolution  Coordinates and develops regular reports and response to ad-hoc data callsRequired Skills:  Proficiency with data analysis, billing analysis  Experience working with WEB based enterprise applications  Experience with provisioning telecommunication services  Proficiency in MS Excel  Strong verbal and written communication skills  Self-management skills to be accountable for specific deliverables Education: Bachelors degree with emphasis in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business, or other technical area or equivalent work experience  Minimum 3 years Data Analysis experience Desired Skills/Certifications: Skilled in the development of documentation, customer reports, and data spreadsheets  Ability to work with multiple cross functional teams  Understanding of databases and troubleshooting, validating, exporting and loading data  Experience with GSA telecom contracts, telecom carrier web portals, and carrier service ordering  Understanding of government contract process  TurningPoint Global Solutions is a fast growing information technology services company that caters to federal, state, and local government and commercial clients.  At TurningPoint Global Solutions, our heritage of innovation and strong software engineering capabilities enables us to provide our full suite of mission-critical solutions in a timely and cost effective manner. The high level of customer satisfaction with our solutions is exemplified by our happy repeat customer base. We take pride in our longstanding reputation of predictability, dependability and corporate decision-making that delivers meaningful results and preserves the longevity of our client partnerships. Founded in 2002, we are privately funded and debt free. TurningPoint Software Engineering process is independently appraised at CMMI Maturity Level 4.  TurningPoint is currently providing software development / maintenance services, IV&V/PMO services, infrastructure support services and enabling technologies to Commercial, State, and Federal Government clients in the areas of telecommunications, Health IT, and e-Commerce technologies.  TurningPoint provides excellent career opportunities and offers a very competitive compensation and benefits package. TurningPoint fosters an environment that encourages teamwork, creativity, and recognition. TurningPoint is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants are considered for employment without any discrimination due to their race, gender, religion, age, marital status, national origin, disability, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by Federal, state, or local law. This policy extends to all aspects of employment with TurningPoint, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring decisions, assignment, advancement, compensation, benefits, retention, and termination.
